title: It jumbled my credit address and…
text: It jumbled my credit address and shipping address into one address.

title: Half happy with purchase
text: The hooked rug which I purchased through your website did not meet my expectations. Bonnie Boswell Antiques altered the colors of the pictures used to advertise the rug. The contrast was pushed to give the rug an almost black frame in the pictures. The actual rug has a mid-tone brown frame. The background of the motif looks cream/white in the ad pictures used, but the actual rug has a tan background. Bonnie Boswell should not alter the colors and contrast of what she is selling. Good points of the transaction: the rug is in good condition and it arrived promptly.

title: I forgot my password and repeatedly for…
text: I forgot my password and repeatedly for two days the reset link did not work. A message to the HELP desk went unanswered.I don't like losing an item because the site is not working correctly.UPDATEi remembered my password last night after another error report from Ruby lane chat submission  si am now able to log in.

title: Checkout grief
text: I found a lovely doll dress that I put in my cart immediately.  The dealers on RubyLane are wonderful and I would not have had a chance to view their items or purchase from them in another format.  But I  have an "active " PayPal account that with  Ruby Lane has always been a problem.  I studied the How to Use PayPal tutorial but there is no icon where it supposed  to  be

title: This was my first purchase on Ruby…
text: This was my first purchase on Ruby Lane.  My comment is nothing against the individual seller; it is against Ruby Lane.  Why give your customers a choice of payment method when you make the final decision?  I entered my credit card information and clicked the button to pay.  Then I received the message "Thank you for your PayPal payment."  Annoying.

title: The RL fees are just too much
text: The RL fees are just too much, up to $250 per item.  Then there are RL shop monthly fees, taxes, shipping and then paypal fees on top take all the profit for sellers and discourage folks from buying.Yes, I see your response but it doesn't change a thing.  All those added amounts including $250 for expensive dolls, is ridiculous.  Buyers are discouraged and sellers are also discouraged.

title: I’m confused
text: I’m confused!  At checkout I paid fully with PayPal and received a confirmation from PayPal that the payment had been made to the seller.  But the message I received at the same time from Ruby Lane says I will be hearing from the seller about payment methods.  This makes me uncomfortable.  Have I paid or not?  Where has my money gone?  Ruby Lane should be more clear about the payment process at checkout.  I won’t relax until I know for sure what’s happening - not in the least a pleasant buying experience.

title: I was very disappointed that the shop…
text: I was very disappointed that the shop owner never responded to my question before shipping. Her shipping  price was outrageous and I asked her if she could possibly ship cheaper. No response , sorry that’s just rude and bad business. She could have just said no.

title: Messages and shipping costs
text: Messages are a mystery. Given Ebay and Etsy both messsge "interally" on their own message board,  RL needs a FAQ item on how it works between buyer and seller.  I was surprised to get an email direct from the other.  It worked, effective, but RL could do more to address the mystery.    Second, shipping was a shock!  $40 to ship a small parcel from US to Canada?!    Fortunately the seller worked to find the REAL cost.

title: Please Support My Browser Again!
text: I love this site and have purchased many items from various sellers. I would rate it a 5 star except for the fact that the site no longer supports my browser (Safari). To use the site efficiently, I have to switch to a different browser, and that definitely means I use the site less. I cannot update my browser. Please consider adding my older version (15.6) back as supported.Otherwise, I really do love the site. Great trustworthy sellers with wonderful offerings!

title: Curious new customer
text: I liked the item I ordered and the dealer that sent it to me got it to me quickly and in good shape with appropriate packaging.What I didn’t like was that there was an automatic extra hundred dollars added to my total for insurance . I declined the insurance because $100 was way more than would be necessary to replace the item and because the first hundred dollars of insurance is included without extra cost to the customer anyway normally ! I don’t know why things were set up that way and I hope you will get it fixed !

title: I really dislike that paypal is the…
text: I really dislike that paypal is the first option for payments. I don't like, nor use paypal anymore. The check-out process feels very high handed and deliberate. Just my opinion based on past experience. Thank you!

title: I didn’t like the fact that this…
text: I didn’t like the fact that this website only ships to the USA. Why bother putting a business online and only cater to your home country without allowing the rest of the world. The internet and online shopping is global capitalism.

title: Risk associated with shops pulling out.
text: Purchased jewelry from a shop on Rubylane. Item was placed on layaway. With only one payment left, the shop left Rubylane and I was on my own to contact the shop and complete the transaction. I’m hoping the shop honors the purchase, I’m optimistic they will. But buyers need to be aware that when shops pull out, there is nothing Rubylane can do to help resolve an issue. I’ve done a lot of business on Rubylane and have been very happy with my purchases. But after this experience, I’m not sure I’m comfortable with the risk.

title: i haven't received any info on when it…
text: i haven't received any info on when it will be shipped or when i can expect to receive the penhowever, i’m really looking forward to its arrival (whenever that might be)i’ve been looking for this particular pen for at least twenty years. i hope it’s in as good a condition as the fotos suggested.thanks for the reply... "Please note all order information, including shipping date and tracking, are entered in the order, and your order displayed all that information, including the tracking number."but i can't find that info anywhere ? where can i locate it? can you send it to me again"Please note all order information, including shipping date and tracking, are entered in the order, and your order displayed all that information, including the tracking number. Choose My Account in the upper right and then Orders. View that order to see all relevant information, including tracking."thanks for your quick response...but i don't see My Account in the upper right corner.i see "HS heron stone" with a dropdown menu consisting of My Reviews, My Settings, Help and Log out...   no My Account or Orders.can you just send me the info please?thank youheron.....................................................OK... i found itTHANK YOU

title: Jumping the gun…
text: I'm giving 3 stars because the email that I received that prompted me to leave this review, also thanked me for making a purchase.  I didn't make a purchase. I made an offer. As of yet, my offer has not been accepted.

title: Poor messaging
text: The messaging between buyers and sellers doesn't work all the time.  The seller didn't get my first message.  Our messaging went to personal emails which worked better.

title: Dear me, what have I gotten myself into!!!
text: Granted, I'm what is generally referred to as technically challenged - maneuvering web-sites is not my idea of fun.  In my simple thinking I fill my cart and the pertinent details so as to affect a sale.What I don't expect is legalize that would require a Philadelphia lawyer to get me through.  Of course, I did not read it believing that if my intent is sound and positive any judge would rule in my favor should it comes to that.I have not not heard from the seller.  What's to happen to the sale?  In fact the seller indicated she has more of the same which interests me.  I'd never seen this coloring in this particular pattern and I am curious.What next can I expect from just anybody??  The seller, Trustpilot - whoever.I love the cup and saucer.  The rest is simply a Royal Pain.  I am sorry to say this.  Is this sale a commitment on my part to do something other than pay the seller?  If so I would like to have clarified to me what is expected in the future as I don't believe I will ever return to this web-site again, alas.

title: Not a very good return policy or protection for buyers.
text: Many interesting pieces here on Rubylane, it’s like walking into the what’s left of the antique shops where everything is old and over priced. I happen to find an earlier miniature dollhouse piece of furniture that the seller knocked off 5.00 to make it more affordable and more at its worth. Unfortunately the item arrived with a splintered off broken leg. I think it’s difficult getting your money refunded and just as difficult returning an item here on Rubylane. I am not happy with their return policy nor the fact that you cannot send the seller any photos of your damaged purchase . I contacted the seller to ask for a refund or discount to which she replied “ how much of a discount and can it be fixed?” As a seller I felt that was a question she should answer and as far as can it be fixed? well I did not purchase a broken item with the description “ a piece for you to fix” I really do not like shopping on Rubylane as my past purchases have had a few problems but after a long absence I thought “why not” now I see why not and will not be returning.

title: Not user friendly, glitches
text: As a first timer, the site is not user friendly. For example, I kept trying to change my shipping address and when I did that, it showed up as billing. Did it several times, was thinking of opening a store on Ruby Lane and wanted to try it out first as a buyer. Glitches. Had to even backdate the date in order for review to be sent. And I don't know why I'm now a guest. Perhaps that was the new payment method.

title: I had a hard time getting signed in to…
text: I had a hard time getting signed in to make a purchase.  I punched the credit cards pictures by mistake I didn’t intend to use pay pal I’ve had a bad experience with pay pal got scammed and they were no help.I’m 75 not a geek should have used the grandkids help.

title: The messaging system could be easier to…
text: The messaging system could be easier to use. Emailing back-and-forth became not very user-friendly. It would be nice to be able to have a messaging system. It would also be nice if Ruby Lane had an app

title: Problem with stock availability
text: I love the selection and reasonable prices at Ruby Lane.  However, the purchase I made last night was rescinded after the sale.  The seller said the item had already sold at one of her other sites.

title: I had to try multiple times to register…
text: I had to try multiple times to register with Ruby Lane.  Could not find my old account, re-registering was clumsy and non-intuitive.  Fine deal on the antique though.

title: I'm having a very difficult time…getting in ebay. because of my paypal
text: I'm having a very difficult time getting on rubylane. because i don't understand why my paypal is not being accepted. I just bought something and I can't get in to pay for it. I will pay with my mastercard. but rubylane will not allow me to get to the purchase area. Why?????

title: Search issues
text: Most issues center on devising a search that brings what I am looking for - usually collectible buttons.  It is difficult to find things without the ability to exclude certain words.

title: Had difficulty paying for my order
text: Had difficulty paying for my order. At first, the site wouldn’t accept my credit card. I had to get out of site a couple of times.  Finally, the site accepted my credit card.

title: The only thing I have a c/o is that…
text: The only thing I have a c/o is that when the seller declined 1st offer I had to write him rather than just sending a 2nd offer.

title: Shipping is too high with insurance…
text: Shipping is too high with insurance tacked on, especially for multiple items from the same seller. There should be combined shipping.

title: I wish RL didn't make it so difficult…
text: I wish RL didn't make it so difficult to use my resale tax number,   rather than pay sales tax I do not pay with my doll business.

title: Cannot access original item photos and description
text: Immediately after making my purchase, the item and its description have disappeared from the Ruby Lane website.  All I can access is the order details page which does not have the original photos and description.  Why is this?  How can I compare what i receive with the seller's description?  Very frustrating.  And not making me happy as a buyer.  RL replied to this review (see below, but the top of that page only said "Drat, this item is sold, please scroll down to see similar items".  no mention of my items' full details being all the way past all that or even on that page.  It would be nice if they added that info at the top of the page.   I had to scroll down past almost 75 items to get to the bottom of the scroll where my purchased item was.   so the first time I did that I gave up after about 24 rows of similar items.  This is a rather dumb system in my opinion.

title: Getting the book was awesome
text: Getting the book was awesome.  Checking out was quite complicated.  I  had to enter the card number and all billing information twice.

title: problem with layaway
text: i'd purchased from this seller on another site - a fantastic seller, b.t.w. - and she transferred an item to ruby lane so i could put on layaway.  possibly because i use a phone only (no access to laptop, etc.) there was trouble with layaway.  looked on google but things it said to click didn't show on my phone.  emailed rl about jt and although totally different from google's directions it was the same there.  rl also let me know layaway was between buyer and seller and they don't get involved (even though i'd already said we'd agreed) so that was worse than uselwss.  ended up saying i would pay by check and in msg said layaway. it charged me the entire amount.  i emailed seller to see about mailibg 4 checks.on 09/12 i received a reply from seller and we agreed to 4 payments although i'd been charged the entire amount by rl.  on 09/13 i received a reply from rl that didn't tell me anything i didn't tell me anything i didn't already know and still gave me absolutely no info on how to do layaways in the future.  NOT a good 1st experience, but if i purchase something outright i may have better luck.  willing to maybe give it another try at some point, but so far not impressed.

title: Aggravating, extremely outdated platform.
text: Ruby Lane continues to make the user experience tedious and poorly designed for buyers. 1. When searching, you cannot specify the price range you want. You must use their range choices. 2. There is no way to stay logged in on a specific device. I can see that there are a certain number of items in my cart, so obviously my identity is known. Yet each time I have to enter my user name and password. 3. This platform hasn't been updated in years. It is outdated and overly complicated. Although I have always been pleased with the items I've purchased and the sellers I've purchased from, buying isn't straightforward either. 4. You have to wait for a seller invoice, even if it's only one item and shipping is free. 5. If the convoluted process of notifying the seller that the item has been received isn't performed, the seller continues to list the item as "pending."  I don't really care, but I don't want to make things more difficult for the seller. 6. Leaving feedback is another chore making it less likely for me to bother. I don't know why I bother reviewing Ruby Lane. I've been saying the same things for YEARS and nothing has changed. I've been informed that THEY are fine with the system as it is. Apparently the buyer is of small consequence.

title: Prompt response
text: I don’t think the tech really understood the issue I was having. But I got a prompt response when I telephoned and was finally able to sort out the issue.

title: I purchased a transferware plate and…
text: I purchased a transferware plate and ended the transaction with a payment via Amex, or so I thought. I was informed the seller would contact me to obtain my credit card info. This is quite an annoyance, having to be tied up, with no time frame as to when the seller might call me, wanting my info! If I had known this prior to committing to the purchase, I would have chosen not to buy the item, even with the good price offered. I prefer the sale to go through with my credit card, just as the transaction is processed, either through Ruby Lane, or the seller. Thank you.

title: No more than I bought the item
text: No more than I bought the item, I could no longer access the original listing with photos. Since I did not make a copy of the description and or the original photo I can no longer access this information. These spoons were produced in different styles and handle types and different sizes. Now I have to wait to receive the spoons to figure out which one I purchased. In my opinion, one should always be able to access the original listing with photos.

title: I don't like it that paypal is the…

title: Have been a Ruby Lane customer for over…
text: Have been a Ruby Lane customer for over 20 years. But stopped shopping as often when taxes were added to customer orders together with shipping charges. No perks were given to the customer for all of the additional charges at any time so I often go to other sites to find the vintage items that I desire.

title: Ruby Lane uses a convoluted system for…
text: Ruby Lane uses a convoluted system for payment. When trying to pay using a credit card (without PayPal) Ruby Lane still directs you to Pay Pal.  I tried following Ruby Lane's instructions, but it appears the transaction still ended up using PayPal/Visa.  Why can't Ruby Lane just provide clicking on either a PayPal icon or credit card icon.  Ruby Lane needs to simplify the payment method and perhaps use ebay as their model.

title: I like it but after several years of…
text: I like it but after several years of selling and never was told that there was a complaint, you seemed to have someone on your team with a vendetta, and would not let me back in after I moved. Si I have lost respect for your management. Rude, and condescending management.

title: Wish there was a way to pay that isn't PayPal
text: I was very excited about the items I was going to buy--but even with a credit card, it was going to go through PayPal and my experience using PayPal is really bad, so I cancelled the order, alas. I was sorry to do so--but every time I have had to use PayPal my credit card has been hacked. So no thanks you.

title: Shipping way too high
text: Shipping way too high. I bought four pieces of flatware and the shipping from same vendor was over $50.00. I would have bought a fifth piece but the shipping was over $70.00. I've bought from Replacements and Ebay and the shipping is nowhere near this level.

title: Good site with limitations
text: I generally like the products and variation of products on Ruby Lane. What I don't care for are all the added costs, like shipping and insurance etc. These are costs of doing business. It's especially disappointing during a 'sale' when you add in all the extras paying full price wouldn't be much different. I certainly have encountered some great sellers on Ruby Lane and I do feel safer buying here than at Ebay which I have been 100% turned off by due to scams and unscrupulous sellers.......

title: Incorrect tax by Ruby Lane
text: In the process of checking out, I noticed a sales tax was added. Since the antique was being shipped to the US from the UK, I knew it was incorrect.  The seller told me Ruby Lane automatically adds the tax and she could do nothing about it.  I did not purchase the item.

title: Postage cost
text: I’m quite sure many buyers would agree with me that Rubylane’s platform could be  better, something like eBay or Etsy where the postage fee can be established first and let known to buyers before they commit to the sale. Take me for example. The sale price of the coral cross pendant was acceptable but it slipped my mind about the postage cost that was yet to be established at that point but unfortunately I have already committed to buy. At US$32 for postage for a small pendant, honestly, I’d probably have second thoughts about this transaction.

title: I collect “antique” dolls and related…
text: I collect “antique” dolls and related items. I find that I look at Ruby Lane much less than I did several months. Months ago, I checked “antique dolls “ daily and made considerable purchases. Now, there are much less antique dolls and related items. The category is more vintage and reproduction.  I would suggest that more stringent rules apply to what is considered and allowed in the antique doll category.

title: I have two complaints
text: I have two complaints.  1) I am purchasing these items for a tax exempt organization, but there is no way to indicate or document this, so tax is applied automatically to my order (which my institution will not reimburse!); 2) the item descriptions disappeared immediately from Ruby Lane, before I had opportunity to copy this useful information.  Is there any way to retrieve this?

title: Shop The World
text: Ruby Lane has been one of my favorite digital shopping sites for a number of years. A world-wide shopping venue that rewards me with rare items that I have wanted to fill-in, complete or build my jewelry collection. I have had positive experiences with each purchase. I am a very satisfied customer. I highly recommend all of the Ruby Lane sites and specialty shopping to  any person hoping to to find something special.

title: I used to buy quite a few things from…

Also the tax is never correct for my area.  It often adds ten dollars extra for the tiny miniatures I am interested in. title: Problems are in the software
text: Problems are in the software. Go to Neatcurios and ask for "metal". Margaret carries a ton of it, but the system will present only six or eight items. Why? If you do a wide search on Ruby for a given item, it won't give you all of it; just most of it. That's difficult when you're looking for a lost item. Also, increase the number of "items viewed" and "shops viewed". Otherwise, a delightful site.

title: Quality of site changed
text: Since fee structure changed many dealers left or post on other sites mostly . QualityOf antiques generally lower and same for porcelain and pottery. It was a mistake to merge antiques with collectibles . Prices are inflated to cover increased costs and are less negotiable . I am a large buyer who bought exclusively in ruby lane . Now I buy more  on ebay and Etsy

title: Unchecked racism
text: Unchecked racismYou have no way to flag offensive items for sale, so there's people on your site selling jewelry of actual racist caricatures that they mark as "ethnic" or don't even describe at all. You also don't check people's bonafides in describing their jewelry as "Native American," when there's a law forbidding people from doing just that.

title: I had no problem with the individual…
text: I had no problem with the individual vendor on my recent purchase.  Ruby Lane is a different story.  I get many error messages when attempting to load pages.  Items have been difficult to save to wish lists.  It's a shame that Ruby Lane can't keep up with the increase in traffic to their site.  I don't plan on visiting as often as I used to.  Shopping is supposed to be fun, not irritating.

title: I haven't received my order yet so I…
text: I haven't received my order yet so I can't comment regarding that. I will say though that when trying to set up an account so that I could purchase it there were many hoops I had to jump through before finally being able to buy.

title: Ruby Lane's website should be designed…
text: Ruby Lane's website should be designed ideally so one could discuss shipping charge with vendor BEFORE committing to the purchase. Today I wanted to purchase items in 3 separate carts. The first 2 carts seem to have proceeded well with those vendors, but the third vendor was charging an outrageous amount for shipping. I did NOT continue with the purchase of the 5 items in that cart.

title: Platform difficulties
text: Hi. To my great despair I have been blocked by several great vendors. The circumstances Are because I have trouble navigating ur site. Specifically when it comes to finishing the PayPal part of order Some vendors immediately put it in to process. Some put it as an additional step. I was assuming it was processed by the vendors who blocked me. It was my not understanding ur platform. I find it distressing not to be able to apologize and explain myself. I realize that blocking is a survival tactic they use. It would at least be nice to have the ruby lane platform serve as a intermediary

title: Quality of offerings is declining.
text: I’ve loved Ruby Lane for years, for great quality unique antique and vintage items. However, in the past few months, ‘vintage’ has begun to mean cheap items like drugstore costume jewelry, decor items from Hallmark and (gasp!) junk from Franklin Mint. While I used to enjoy my coffee examining the most recent offerings, I’m becoming less and less interested. I don’t want to look at $10 items I can find at lawn sales!  What has happened to you?

title: Quality of items have gone down
text: I have very good experiences with dealers across the board so I would give 5 stars for thatHowever the quality of the offerings in the middle to high end is much lower in general than it’s used to be and many of the quality dealers are now showing on other sites .

title: Great and not great
text: I have bought a couple of pieces, not expensive ones, and found the two sellers trustworthy and professional. What does concern me is that many sellers don't seem to have any idea about antiques and everything defaults to Art Deco. Most of it is not Art Deco or even that style in a reproduction. Check guarantees and if the seller has a return policy I would have any jewelry checked locally. There is some great jewelry and some reasonable prices but I would be careful of anything labeled antique

title: Great stock, love to see more willing to Ship to Australia
text: Have follow Ruby Lane for awhile, love the photos and information, though sadly living in Australia, lots of vendors are anxious about the shipping I was glad I could actually purchase from a US vendor, by asking the question of that Vendor, who was very accommodating and updated her site to include Shipping to Australia.  Maybe there could be something that promotes or shows this in initial sale photos. Thks

title: I love Ruby Lane and all things…but unhappy with shipping costs.
text: I love Ruby Lane and all things antiques. I would make many more purchases if shipping wasn’t so expensive. Maybe if you offered an option with a membership (yearly) for free shipping costs. I have so many options for free shipping, I rarely buy from anyone that charges to ship.

title: Initial Logistical problem.
text: The service so far is good (but I have only just placed my first order). I've rated the site with only three stars because I had difficulty entering the name of the Province where I live and require delivery. The site was fairly insistent in only listing U. S. states until I put in the Postal Code, then it recognized the problem and began to provide for the name of a Province.I may have additional comments upon receipt of the purchase.

title: The problem with RubyLane besides now…too many fees!
text: The problem with RubyLane besides now charging tax is that there are multiple added costs like shipping insurance and at point some crazy administrative fee. I totally stopped buying on RubyLane because of that until seeing that it disappeared. I messaged several dealers to tell them exactly why I had not gone through with a purchase.

title: Premature
text: Ruby Lane requested a review after I purchased something but before it was received.  How can I fix the  level of excellence when I don't know what Ruby Lane would do if something went wrong with the sale and the seller wouldn't make it right? That is when the quality of an antiques website really shows. Regarding the purchase, it was easy to find what I wanted, easy to contact the seller, and easy to complete the purchase.  I suggest Ruby Lane change the timing of  the review request to  cover the whole process.  I would think that would be of interest, and I might have been able to give five stars.

title: They don't often deliver to Canada and…
text: They don't often deliver to Canada and when they do, shipping can get any where between $14.00- $30.00 or more. Plus USD FEEs make shopping expensive. Wish they would branch out and open in Canada too. Beautiful quality products, just frustrating when you can't get a delivery to Canada.

title: you have some great collectible items…
text: you have some great collectible items but,, the individual sellers need to ''REMOVE'' sold items when they are sold!i just went through trying to purchase an item to find out it was already sold....thats why i am giving 3 stars.. sellers need to pay attention to their site. thanks

title: I do not have a PayPal account
text: I do not have a PayPal account, nor do I want one. Placing this order was confusing to me....I'm not finding fault with the vendor but I am annoyed by the multiple emails about this order to try get me to sign up for a PayPal account. One especially offensive was the email with an INVOICE to tell me to pay when in fact, my VISA account showed the debit before this particular email even arrived. Earlier this year, I bought a pendant from another vendor and don't remember the same thing happening as this did today.

title: Request confirmation of purchase from seller.
text: It has been over 3 days and my purchase, which has been paid in full, has not been acknowledged by the seller whose shop is listed on Ruby Lane.  I paid for expedited shipping too, and would like to have a delivery timeframe as this is a birthday gift, not a Christmas gift. Overall Ruby Lane is a great platform and I use it often.

title: I enjoyed shopping RubyLane, but am disappointed in my purchase
text: I enjoyed shopping on RubyLane. So many shops & beautiful options. The ring I purchased arrived quickly & securely. And looked even better than pictured online! I was very disappointed when less than a week later a diamond fell out. I have not reached out to the shop yet-not sure what they can even do. I like the ring; don’t want to send it back. It’s estate/vintage-things happen. But I do wonder if a jeweler checked it properly before it was offered for sale. I would still shop on RubyLane again & recommend it.

title: complicated process,many steps involved
text: complicated process,many steps involvedi chose to pay by mastercard,the system defaulted to pay pal which i dont use,i cant seem to be able to change it to mastercardBilling address not same as shipping address,i cant seem to change it myself''

title: Antique dealers should not be paying…
text: Antique dealers should not be paying tax when items are bought for resale. No provision appears to be made to get dealers tax i.d. numbers to facilitate this.It limits purchases on Ruby Lane.

title: I really love the variety of items on Ruby Lane
text: I really love the variety of items on Ruby Lane. Prices are very reasonable on most items. I would’ve given five stars if the functionality of the website was easier to use. It’s very difficult to make or accept offers and it’s difficult to pay for items. I wish the site would’ve given the option to reject or accept offers instantly instead of handling business through a series of emails that turns into a waiting game.  The current set up of this site is too confusing & disappointing, especially for newbies.

title: I would recommend using site off a…
text: I would recommend using site off a computer. It was my first time using the site and i was using a cellphone but it was laggy and froze as i was making an offer and it all of a sudden did a full price purchase. Got it fixed more by a gentleman seller but that wasnt cool.

title: This is my first experience with Ruby…
text: This is my first experience with Ruby Lane and it was a bit confusing. I wanted to pay with my credit card, but you automatically charged my PayPal account, which I did NOT appreciate! And, you automatically charge for insurance?? I am not likely to shop from you again, but we will see.

title: Feeling unfriendly Purchasing
text: I’m feeling unfriendly during purchasing an antique calling card case.1) when I enquiry is there any discount of this item with Politely.The feedback is 10%2) and then, I ask to send me a link for make payment. Until about 22:30 23 /12 is no reply.3) Lately, I make a full payment of an antique calling card case and ask seller when will be shipped out of the subject item , still no feedback until this moment.I’m afraid your company’s good image will be influenced.Actually, this is my second time for purchasing.(First time purchasing is very happy. The seller is kind , helpful and good service.)Merry Christmas and happy New Year

title: Loved the product but beware
text: Loved the product but beware. They had a “sale” that knocked the price to half off, which was promptly added to shipping making it the same price as before. Charged $11something for a flat rate small box which costs $7something. I probably won’t order from here again sadly.

title: I really like the miniature turtle
text: I really like the miniature turtle.  Even though I purchased it for 1/2 price, the outrageous cost of shipping such a small item upped the price to almost the original price.  I could mail that in a USPS small flat rate box for $8-9 maximum.

title: Middle of the pack site
text: Have not shopped on Ruby Lane for many years of my experience this morning told me why. It was difficult signing up… Again, search was not intuitive, shipping was hard to find. Selection is not great insight navigation is awkward… All in all appears to be amateur hour.

title: Sometimes these things happen
text: Sometimes, products are so artfully photographed that they look better in photos than in life.  Sometimes, items are priced without taking into account numerous holes (in lace, for example) and the vendor ignores inquiries about same.Sometimes, photos do not give a true sense of the size of the item.  Those photos with coins, rulers, items in held in the palm of the hand, etc. which allow us to get a true sense despite centimeter or inch measurements work well.Shipping expenses can be as more or more than inexpensive items, don't know if there's any fix for this other than having RubyLane or vendor pitch in.Thanks

title: Shipping charges
text: To Whom It May Concern,I just ordered and sent an email to the copy concerning the high shipping cost.  My shipping rate was 50% of my purchase and I just feel that is very extreme.  I would appreciate a partial refund.Thank you for your attention to this matter.

title: Still waiting and wondering
text: Hi, I made a purchase on the 15th of July, and outside of Ruby Lane emailing me payment confirmation, I have no idea of the shipping status, no tracking number, no communication from shop owner. I hope to see my US priority mail package soon.....

title: Dollhouse-collecting Difficulties
text: I am happy that Ruby Lane offers a wide variety of antique dollhouse items to enrich my enjoyment of collecting them, but it is very frustrating that these items are rarely pictured with rulers.  As a result it is time-consuming to click on each picture to learn what scale an item is, and sometimes the size is never given at all.  Since there are hundreds of items on offer, I am sure that most customers, like myself, rarely have the time or patience to search the complete inventory for the desired scale.  Please consider requiring sellers to include a ruler in photos or size in the initial description.

title: Have made many purchases from various…
text: Have made many purchases from various dealers on ruby lane. Always been pleased till last purchase. Been nearly a week and just heard that my item was shipped, but no tracking #. Guess ive been spoiled by the quick responses of previous dealers. Disappointing

title: Losing Good Customers
text: While I think rl has some excellent sellers with high quality items, I find there are sellers who post maybe two or three pictures for an item when clearly many more are needed.  Is it arrogance on the part of the seller?  Do they think they have such a reputation that they need not post more?  Is it laziness?  I don’t know.  What I do know is that it is annoying to have to write and ask for more or better pictures.Fortunately, there are some sellers whose photo arrays and descriptions are in a class by themselves and it is to these sellers, I am drawn.  A pity that the sellers who skimp on their listings don’t realize they are missing out on possible good customers.As a whole, though, I find Ruby Lane a good place for shopping and buying.

title: I have bought many antique dolls over…
text: I have bought many antique dolls over the years when there wasn’t a tax added. After RL started charging dealers high fees, it turned into high taxes for customers. I have been buying a lot less from Ruby Lane for that reason.

title: I think you should put payment options…
text: I think you should put payment options before the checkout, not as you check out. Before the check-out there was only a pay pal logo, so I joined pay pal, not what I wished to do. Then I clicked on checkout and found there were other payment options.

title: I had a great experience with my latest…
text: I had a great experience with my latest purchase.  The site worked well with no glitches and the seller was extremely prompt with replies to my questions.  I must say, however, that in general the quality of products on Ruby Lane is quite low.

title: If you need  any help from Ruby Lane…
text: If you need  any help from Ruby Lane you be on your own. I had problem with a dealer saying after 5 weeks of not shipping an order. That she wasn’t paid. I gave invoice number had no help . Not happy with service regarding problems.

title: I don’t like having to wait on total
text: I don’t like having to wait on total, waiting on vendor on when they might look at their online store? I can’t figure if I am buying or not??Guess I’ll look elsewhere too?Sandy

title: Purchase and billing steps are very…
text: Purchase and billing steps are very confusing.  I have STILL to click the payment icon, because so far no complete total of costs has been given.  I will not continue with payment before I know how much the shipping charge will be.

title: Not worth my time.
text: This site needs to have the option to pay at the time of purchase and get an order confirmation and shipment details in a timely manner thereafter. They need stricter deadlines for sellers to fulfill an order once it has been received. Finally, they need to NOT charge you $ until your item was shipped.  I was emailed an invoice leaving me to wonder if my purchase had been successful. I was then charged via PayPal for my item and left to wait around for a week wondering if/when my item would ship. I didn’t receive any confirmation or tracking info from the seller. I had to reach out to them to ask where my stuff was… Too much work on my part and too much anxiety to bother buying anything from this site ever again.

title: The advertisement did not say that some…
text: The advertisement did not say that some of the clothes had tears and holes. Also, the clothes smelled musty, like a basement. The clothes should have been  handwashed before sending.

title: I get confused during check out
text: I get confused during check out. Did not let me check out all 4 of items I wanted. Only 1 at a time. Don't know where the 4th item is.  Don't want on pay pal.  Want to put on my other credit card.Too confusing.  Judy Gindle

title: I am a long time customer of Ruby Lane.  Assistance needed.
text: I am a long time customer of Ruby Lane, and love the website.Using your sale this week, I purchased a small bronze statue, and requested shipping to my son, Michael Stratta, 2959 N Troy St. Chicago, 60618.However the receipt today shows shipping address to me in Vincennes, Ind.I have reached out to the seller for verification, but already have a tracking number, 9405828206335382891028.  I would like to know what happened to the shipping address I added, and if I have made an error.I am hoping the shipment can be redirected.This is the only time I have had issues in over ten years of shopping.Thank you for anything you can do to assist.Liz Thomas

title: Ring is just as pictured
text: Ring is just as pictured.  Dealer insisted on a 'no return' policy which seemed to go against Ruby Lane posted policy, but I took a chance and am not disappointed.  It seemed like a risk however.

title: Difficult Check-Out

title: Your site is simple and functional to…
text: Your site is simple and functional to utilize and your customers' administrations are exceptionally quick and powerful. In any case, I am not happy with you as a result of your low-speed site stacking page.

title: I love RL as they have great items
text: I love RL as they have great items, but they are priced way over the top. I can find items in antique stores for less. Shipping and handling plus taxes are astronomical.Kim

title: Please update your system!!
text: I buy and sell on Ruby Lane.  There are many things I like about Ruby Lane, and many things I don't.  First off, your whole presentation  for buying  and selling is antiquated.  As a seller I loose buyers because they cannot navigate your system.  As a seller, I myself find it hard to correct things, change details, update listings, etc., the list goes on.  I have buyers tell me that RL's system is not user friendly.  There is just not a smooth flow from one item to the next.  Your processed imaging is ridiculous!  Taking a day to get an item listed is terrible!  And, I don't understand why all of my photos look so fuzzy once uploaded to RL.  They don't on other sites.  Please consider a new program!

title: Too much low end junk
text: Too much low end junk. When you are searching for an antique it needs to be at least 100 years old- not mixed in with a bunch of junky collectibles.

title: I do wish postal updates were sent once merchandise has shipped.
text: I do wish, as a buyer, auto postal info was given. I never know when or if it has shipped. As there is usually quite a long wait on receiving purchase, updates would be sensible to add to your set-up.
