title: Not satisfied with customer service
text: I made a bracelet purchase during the Red Tag 50% off sale. Weeks went by, and no activity. It hadn't been shipped. I tried emailing the shop owner, twice, without success. I contacted RL, was told I needed to contact PayPal. I did, but just prior to doing that, I tried once more to contact the shop owner. The site said, "shop is in preview, and unavailable at this time". I then let RL know I had contacted PayPal. After review, and several more emails, my money was restored, even though I would have preferred receiving the bracelet. I feel RL could have been more supportive of my efforts. What does "in preview" mean?  Was RL able to contact the shop owner?  Was there a good, honest explanation for why this transaction wasn't completed?  I feel RL should have followed up with me on this as good customer service policy. I spent a lot of time writing emails back and forth and wasn't offered either an explanation or an apology.

title: Good quality..
text: Date of experience: October 04, 2020

title: I say average because the package came to me and not to the shipping address!
text: I say average because the package, a wedding present, was delivered to me even though the email receipt & tracking information show that I had a different shipping address, the address where I wanted the package to go.  I love the ease of browsing on Ruby Lane and the products are excellent, but at some part in the process, my order was mis-routed.

title: Difficult to us website
text: Difficult to us website. Never was able to find what I was looking for, even though I found it last night.  Then when I tried to order something else from Ruby Lane website, I got tangled up in passwords.  I came extremely close to saying “forget it “

title: The locket I received was not exactly…
text: The locket I received was not exactly as described.  There is a small dent to it and some of the etching has faded away.  There are also some scratches and overall around the engraving which makes it difficult to see the entire name.  I'm disappointed.

title: Email address issues
text: There is an issue with the Ruby Lane website and my email address, although eventually I was able to place my order with Paypal.  Kindly look into this . . .

title: I found trying to purchase quite…frustrating
text: I found trying to purchase quite difficult. I was asked for my email and password but when I tried to hit the sign up nothing happened. I had to then try signing up even though I was not a member. That, naturally did not work. So I tried again to sign up, but again the sign up button wasn’t working. I went through this process three times before I got a sign up form. Since I really wanted the item I finally was able to buy it but it was a frustrating experience and would have disgusted another would-be buyer I think.

title: I had trouble changing my ship to…
text: I had trouble changing my ship to address.  I finally gave up and just had the package sent to my bill to address.

title: When they keep rejecting my email…
text: When they keep rejecting my email address.  I don't know what to do.  It kept me from the 50% off sale. Also battled me today.  Seems to be working now.

title: Need to make some changes
text: Had difficulty changing billing address and never got email to change password even though I get all emails from Ruby Lane ridiculous!!

title: Your web site is not user friendly
text: Your web site is not user friendly.  Ruby lane does offer wonderfully items.  Please insist that sellers who offer layaway will allow it when you buy.  The same seller advertised layaway but refused to allow it twice.  #1 excuse: $395.00 item not expensive enough to put on layaway (no mention of minimum in listing). #2 excuse : layaway not worth  the time   I spoke to this seller by telephone so you probably don't have a record of our discussion. I have used layaway dozens of times and have never failed to honor them.  I offered names for references but it made no difference with this seller.  If is embarrassing to have a seller refuse layaway when she has offered it in her listing. The feelings of a customer should be important to a seller and Rubylane.  I emphasize that her refusal cannot have been to my buying history as I have a perfect layaway history.

title: Excessive Shipping
text: The doll clothes lot I bought have a mildew/old/antique store type odor that was not described by the seller. But, My big issue is that I was charged 36% more than the actual shipping cost.I had to Pay for USPS Priority Flat Rate Service, which the seller didn't even utilize. She shipped in a regular USPS Box. She charged me $15.50, actual cost was $9.90.Myself an online seller for 19 years, shipping is always the big elephant in the room. I would have expected the seller to honestly return some of the Excessive Shipping Fees on her own. She did not. Shipping fees are for shipping the item. Not for the seller to recap their seller fees. This practice is frowned upon on the sites I sell on. I don't know that Ruby Lane monitors Excessive Shipping, but I am calling it to Your Attention.

title: PROBLEM SIGNING IN
text: Hello, I had a problem signing in to purchase an item this evening. Ruby Lane now does not recognize my primary e-mail address, which was accepted in the past but today was rejected. To purchase an item, I had to use my secondary e-mail address. How can that problem be corrected so that my primary e-mail address is reinstated? With thanks, Jane

title: Glitch ➡️ Disappointment
text: Very disappointed in this past sale. I had spent a few days choosing some items from trusted sellers I had purchased from in the past. I put them in carts, waited until the day of the sale, set my alarm and went to purchase those items I wanted. First I got an error message (broken gateway), then I was able to purchase. I did not pay for them as I noticed shipping wasn’t combined and I wanted to ask the seller to alter my invoice. Somehow, one of my items was purchased from under me even though I had already checked out with it. Extremely disappointed! Had worked hard to find what I wanted.

title: Good variety, bad website infrastructure
text: Lots of variety on the site, but the site is very slow, and the infrastructure isn't in place to handle sale events - I had the site go down multiple times while trying to purchase items during the latest tag sale.

title: Need diversity training
text: I searched for African American art, and a piece with a bunch of monkeys was in the search result. No bueno. The company needs some internal audits and diversity training.

title: Be careful when paying for orders so you don’t lock the purchase
text: The problem was mine. I put something in my cart, went to the cart to pay, selected PayPal, logged into same. All fine to that point. Then accidentally hit cancel. Oops! Returned to cart to begin process again. RubyLane had removed it from my cart. Tried to buy again, cannot do, “item is in someone’s cart” and unavailable. Ergo no sane way to pay for it until I went to My Account” and saw an invoice for same. Was able to connect with PayPal from there. A bit confusing until I got it figured out. Your system “removed” a cancelled item from my cart but did not but did not release it from “someone’s” cart—making me locked out of buying something that was invisible but still in my cart. It essence it made me into 2 separate individuals. Your site is terrific, I love it, but one must be careful!

title: It was very difficult for me to use…
text: It was very difficult for me to use your system. I was never able to e-mail you for help or communicate with the seller (still can't). A message kept showing up that you sent an e-mail to my address and it was returned to you as undelivered. That message is still showing up - and I still can't e-mail you or the seller. I called your San Fran help number and got a message that no one was there to help. Three stars is the best I can do.  Hope that changes because I have my eye on other things.

title: Confusing communications
text: Confusing communications - paid with PayPal, had a confirmation from PayPal, yet their site said I needed to complete the transaction.

title: For the most part
text: For the most part, everything is too pricey as compared to similar or same items on eBay,Etsy, etc  Inflated prices include the items for sale, postage, and sometimes no choice of whether or not to buy insurance.  Is RL charging vendors too much that gets passed along to buyers?    Also, site can be a time-waster: for example, putting item in wish list takes three or four steps,  checkout is not easy to navigate. And recent changes to search pages leaves customer with no way, that I could find, to access detailed info on size, materials used, etc until one puts item in wish list first and then backtracks to retrieve wanted info.  And it nearly always takes longer to receive an order in the mail from RL than from eBay and sometimes Etsy.

title: Great items
text: Great items, website is hard to navigate.  I searched a keyword, but the item wouldn't show up in results.  The keyword clearly shows up in other pages with similar items.  I guess its the search that's the problem.

title: Shipping was way TOO high!
text: Shipping is way TOO high, it makes your awesome prices not worth it in the end!  Don't think I'll be doing much shopping here.  Really have to check my options against your added shipping and insurance!  You do have a very nice webpage and selection. It was an interesting experience and I did purchase two items...thank you.

title: I had trouble with the site
text: I had trouble with the site, but it was better a couple hours later. I was shopping the UFDC event site, and it seems that in my first session, half the dealers were not there. I'm glad I gave it a second try.I get regular emails from Ruby Lane and I feel that it is normally smooth sailing.

title: I find their site to be a little…
text: I find their site to be a little confusing. I want to look something up & see that item. Instead I see different items and not the ones I want. It could be so much more user friendly.

title: Very round about procedures to pay…
text: Very round about procedures to pay using Paypal.

title: Make it easier to order
text: It is somewhat difficult to order from this site.

title: Poor customer service
text: Placed an order and I was unable to complete the payment portion of the order. It too many tries to get a response from the shop owner. She didn’t seem to really understand the problem. I finally canceled the order.

title: This is a difficult website to use
text: This is a difficult website to use.  Drop down menus don't list all options ie "register".

title: Frustrated a seler does not honor the…Frustrated.
text: Frustrated a seler does not honor the stated time payment is due on a sale pendingitrmor respond tomy emails. I want a doll but as days pass,I can spend my money elsewhere onanotherdolli wantalthough I am eeay sndworry abot angering the seller with my repeated emails andafraid to call and will do since I try to buy the doll I want.  And, an answer-if this doll can be bought by-mePlease help me to getananswer and relieve my misery of trying to buy a doll I truly want.

title: I'm old..
text: I'm old... patience is thin... I tried several times to change my password and the link provided (3 times) didn't work. For over 20 minutes I tried different things and frustratingly failed. Finally I realized my "nickname" was my email address and not my username and was able to change it on the Rubylane site. This was a very bad shopping experience. I need a nap after this one.

title: Making offers
text: Making offers was very confusing.  Streamline it like eBay

title: There were no instructions to inform me…
text: There were no instructions to inform me how this "Internet Antiques Show"was going to work.  I made an offer but got no response so I circled back to outright buy the item.  I had no idea when I would get a response.  You still do not have a way of dealing with sales tax.  I have resale certificates in New York State and Maryland, from where I purchased the item.  The issue with the sales tax has been a thorn in my side since the beginning of the internet sales tax regulation.  Other multi dealer sites have managed to deal with it.  I can't understand why you have not made an effort.  You are losing my business.

title: Many of their dolls and accessories are…
text: Many of their dolls and accessories are beautiful and the prices seem reasonable. However it seems that I do not get notification that there are new items until much later after they have been posted . At that point everything has been bought. I would like to know how some  people are able to see their new items before others? It is rather disappointing!

title: Great merchandise and well priced but…
text: Great merchandise and well priced but ordering is kludgey and it forces you to use Paypal for processing even if you use a credit card which adds extra costs and makes the transaction harder and slower. 5 stars for the merchandise and the very responsive seller who was lovely to deal with, but 3 stars for the site's ecommerce capabilities.

title: shipping info
text: I don’t like not being able to find shipping info on purchases. I never know when or if an item has posted. If info is there it sure isn’t easy to find.

title: Participating in the Barn Star/Ruby…
text: Participating in the Barn Star/Ruby Lane on-line sale and you guys are NOT making it easy. The website is cumbersome to navigate, making an offer required 6 extra steps. If you are going to do this, it really needs to be simplified

title: Be prepared for obscenely high shipping charges.
text: Everything was fine until I went to pay for my order—I was charged OVER $30 shipping for 7 decks of playing cards! That’s just obscene. Insurance coverage on those cards would’ve been over $12 more, too.

title: Adequate but not nimble
text: Adequate but not nimble. Unable to adjust tax charges for an exempt buyer

title: Still waiting for my purchase after 30…
text: Still waiting for my purchase after 30 days. I understand about the covid 19 ..but still 30 + days is a very long time to wait after purchasing somthing .I have purchased other things in the past from Ruby Lane . With  great resualts and hope to again in the future

title: I did not make a purchase
text: I did not make a purchase, I only put in an offer. This is review is premature.

title: Shipping and insurance costs too high
text: The shipping and insurance costs are out of market.  They are too expensive and do not compare favourably to other webistes. In any counter offer you should also be able to counter offer on the price of shipping and insurance costs as these are more than double some other competitor webistes.  Are these a profit centre for Ruby Lane?

title: website is confusing…
text: I found it hard to sign onto the website.  This was my first time using this website.  I was expecting to pay for my order when I placed it but then found my email that said I would be contacted by the seller before payment can be made.  This was confusing since nothing was mentioned anywhere.

title: Very narrow reach
text: Very narrow reach. Very few purchases via Ruby. Most via 1stdibs. There is a technical issue on Ruby's part that exists nowhere else. I am constantly told that my email address, gloriousity@optonline is rejected and an email sent comes back. This is my working email address. My problem is only on Ruby.I get all email otherwise. Ruby corrects the issue and it returns constantly. Gloria Karp. Glorious Antique Jewelry

title: When sellers needed to charge state…
text: When sellers needed to charge state tax, the rates were not accurate.  I asked the seller why they were overcharging, and they advised that it is the state tax PLUS A HANDLING CHARGE that Ruby Lane added.  Some sellers refund those overcharges or ship free to keep buyers satisfied.  It would be more equitable to just charge the correct tax amount or have the sellers make those tax charge amounts on their own.

title: I don't usually shop Ruby Lane as They…
text: I don't usually shop Ruby Lane as They have a poor selection of the things I like and when I do find an item I want the prices are exceptionally high, much like antique store pricing before the internet when they controlled the market.  The pricing is unrealistic but every now and then something slips through the cracks or they are having a big sale.  Then I can afford something.

title: The prices are fine but the shipping…
text: The prices are fine but the shipping and insurance is high. I ship all the time I know what it should be. Therefore I only ended up buying one of the four items I had selected to purchase.

title: Duplicate sale listings?
text: When you have your sales, I like to see every piece of sale jewelry.  There seems to be quite a bit of duplication of pieces.  The present sale has 55 pages.  I notice quite a few pieces are shown twice, and even three times.  Is that a sales tactic, or mistake?  I feel the less pages to go through, the more time I can spend on each one.  I usually end up taking till 4 A.M. the day of the sale to finish shopping.  I always end up buying, but I hate wasting time on duplicate listings.                                                                       Diane Prinz

title: I used to love Rubylane but now the…
text: I used to love Rubylane but now the prices have become very high. I hear it is because there was a new fee tacked onto the dealers there. This was after they tried to get Buyers to pay a fee and it did not go away very well. I still browse but with the high prices and the addition of sales tax I won’t be buying much now.

title: Item descriptions are inadequate
text: Item descriptions are inadequate.  A seller might list a drop earring, but not provide the dimensions.  In this example, the length of the drop.I no longer message a seller whose description is lacking.

title: anything good for sale is beyond retail…
text: anything good for sale is beyond retail prices so it's waste of time buying here!

title: Where is the registration link on your home page?
text: I found it difficult to register and could not find a link for registration on the home page.  Even when I googled it, I was taken to a registration area to registrar as a seller (shop).  I almost gave up.

title: Not your fault
text: Not your fault, but HATE  the shipping charges.

title: Web site is difficult to user
text: Web site is difficult to user.  There is no really easy way to navigate when you are setting up a new account.

title: Its really hard to rate
text: Its really hard to rate. This was my first experience and I found your purchase procedure is a little confusing.

title: You make it difficult to use your site…
text: You make it difficult to use your site easily.  I made a purchase and you charged me tax.  I have a tax/resale number and I want my money refunded!!  I would not want to be a seller and being a buyer was complicated.

title: Most sellers are excellent. Ruby Lane is iffy.
text: Most sellers are wonderful but Ruby Lane company has a lot to be desired. They really march to their own drummer and as a buyer they are near useless. Rules change as to their preferences and they don’t protect the buyer what so ever. So you need to really trust your seller to be protected. Sellers do leave and I’ve been burnt out of 500.00 so buyer beware.

title: From a buyer & seller’s view
text: From a buyer’s perspective, the process is relatively clean although I am unhappy with the additional taxes/fees that are being placed on my purchases. In all honesty as a seller I’m completely disappointed in the stance that Ruby Lane has taken with charging small businesses across the board fees and taxes. This is only applicable from a tax perspective if a seller is selling an excess of $100,000 per year on the site. Also, our margins are extremely tight. To charge a 6.7% across-the-board is unacceptable. If a $1400 Item cost a seller$1000, the margin after monthly fees and listing costs is less than $400. Then you take 6.7% $93.80 leaves a seller with very low returns. In actuality you’re  consuming up to 25% of a sellers profit. Furthermore, requiring access to our PayPal accounts is extraordinarily uncomfortable. Your platform has become extremely controlling. It’s not the warm wonderful place it started out to be.

title: We Love the Art Deco Lamp !
text: First, to clarify; because we were able to complete the purchase of the lovely art deco lamp we'd give you a 10 on that count and for being there. For the purchase for newcomers though it was difficult. The web site lacks an intuitive path for knowing you must create an account before being able to attempt signing in and  to make a purchase. After many tries the help button became necessary to move ahead but that worked well.Thanks for being there and all the fun items in your store !Robert

title: Have way too much trouble getting in to…
text: Have way too much trouble getting in to make payment.  Most always states my password is incorrect and after several tries it will accept it.

title: The RL fees are now making prices…
text: The RL fees are now making prices prohibitive because vendors increase price to cover. I am buying less. Also I don't like the combination of antiques and collectibles. Some dealers or comparable ones are available on other sites.. Fewer things are being sold. No longer the premiere site it was. Used to be five star

title: I found the payment part kind of…
text: I found the payment part kind of squirrelly. Pulling the money before knowing the sellers response made me nervous. The whole “ offer” thing would definitely keep me from listing stuff at ruby Lane.

title: Not sure what happened to Ruby Lane
text: Not sure what happened to Ruby Lane. So few listings these days. Some of my favorite sellers are no longer on the site. Too bad.

title: Credit card payment would be nice.
text: Payment option is Paypal or money order. My iPad for some reason won’t allow me to do Paypal so trying with money order and have never done that so a bit frustrating. Would appreciate if we could use a credit card. Otherwise everything is good. And yes, guess it’s mostly an iPad or Paypal problem.

title: Relatively expensive listings
text: Relatively expensive listings. I only shop when there is a sale as otherwise most items are overpriced.

title: The experience is still pending
text: The experience is still pending.  I found it a bit awkward.  I do a lot of online shopping, but this is the first time I was unable to enter my debit card info to finalize the purchase at the time I placed the order.  I don't understand why the vendor has to call me to get the info, unless your site is not secure.  There is also some confusion about the shipping, insurance and tax charges.  The drop down menu on the Ruby Lane site says shipping to the US is $19.99 and insurance is included. (taxes TBD)   However, a final tally in my cart showed $29.98 for shipping, $6.00 for insurance and $19.31 tax.  Then, my email from the vendor showed $24.98 for shipping, insurance was, in fact, included and $18.57 for tax!  I think we all need to get on the same page. I hope my review will help you improve.   I have not seen the items I have ordered.  I trust they will not disappoint.  Linda

title: My experience with Ruby Lane has been…
text: My experience with Ruby Lane has been largely positive. But there have been several occasions when I have been charged a restocking fee on a returned item for no apparent reason. It has made me more cautious about buying items that I don't see first hand. Jewelry stores on Ebay don't have this practice. Some don't accept returns and it is plainly stated on the first page of the listing, not in the small print. I tend to go to Ebay first for jewelry shopping. I get better prices and less surprises in the form of 20% restocking fees.

title: Very disappointed in how difficult it is to navigate between pay immediately or lay-away...
text: It's very confusing to agree with a seller to place an item on lay-away, yet you have to first put it in your cart and then there is no where to check a box that states "this is a law-away item". It immediately wants you to check the box on how you are going to pay and then immediately takes you into the pay in full lane. Tonight I became so frustrated over this that I went ahead and paid the full $586. amount because I didn't have the time to figure it out !!!!  Perhaps this is your intention.....

title: one buys an item
text: one buys an item, a doll in my case, one pays with Paypal and there is no email sent to say: "Your order has been placed and thank you."Going back to the site I read: "SALE PENDING".Pending what?Several hours later still no sign of recognition or confirmation one has completed a purchase.Compared to Ebay, RubyLane exchages are much less pleasant.Sincerely,AML

title: My opinion was better before RL began…
text: My opinion was better before RL began charging taxes and service/handling charges! For me, this means the difference in purchasing or not purchasing. If I was affluent or rich, of course, it wouldn't make the difference. The handling charge is particularly irritating!

title: Not Happy With RL Processing Fee
text: At one time I would have given Ruby Lane 5 Stars. I do not like the way the processing fee suddenly appeared on my invoice during their 50 % off sale in November 2019. No warning, it just appeared.  What a perfect time for them to do this. I believe they used the excuse it was to help with the processing of deducting state taxes. I'm not helping RL with their accounting processes by paying more for an item.  I stopped shopping on their website because of it. I have since come back to shop because the processing fee has since been removed. I hope Ruby Lane will gain my trust again.  There are many wonderful shops on their website however a few I use to purchase from are gone. I'm assuming they left for the same reason. .

title: Very difficult to shop from your phone…
text: Very difficult to shop from your phone on this site.

title: Difficult
text: Very difficult to navigate site, awkward and confusing.

title: There should be an EASY way to not be…
text: There should be an EASY way to not be charged sales tax. I purchase a lot of items for my business. I have a valid  sales tax licence with the state of Arizona. Just this morning I paid over $100 for fabric that should not be a taxable item. Sales tax is always added and I know of no way to avoid it. Any help with this problem would be appreciated.

title: added fees
text: The prices are reasonable but by the time you go to check out the added fees can be as much as 30% over the cost of the doll.  This is very discouraging!Linda

title: I cannot contact the seller for this…
text: I cannot contact the seller for this necklace.  I didn't want to use PayPal but it wouldn't go to the credit card I wanted to use master card.   How do I contact the seller to tell her that.Kathy Wasson

title: I do not like many of the recent…
text: I do not like many of the recent changes to the site. So much space is taken up by the header you have to scroll down to begin to see the items. The currency converter is gone. I am not impressed by Ruby Lane adding a 'surcharge' to the items.

title: I am unable to pay with Paypal due to…
text: I am unable to pay with Paypal due to bank fraud on my paypal account a year ago.  My bank feels it is not secure for my useage.  It is difficult (impossible?) for me to be able to find another payment method.   Can that be fixed, so that another payment method is easily available?

title: Quality of products is low and prices…
text: Quality of products is low and prices are high.  In particular I look for dolls and jewelry.

title: The website is hard to work through to…
text: The website is hard to work through to the place for payment.  I waited several days for notification of how to proceed and it was not until I received a notice from the vendor that I "rummaged" through the website to locate the point of sale.

title: Postage / shipping.
text: Disappointed with over charging on postage (shipping) Do ask for items weight before buying anything.Small lightweight items (even with insurance) with $3 & $4 price difference overcharge. Grrrr. Postal Gouging when I bought!

title: Honest antiques
text: Honest antiques, overpriced but 90% true to what is offered. Don't believe everything you read,  do your research and then make sure you're 100% sure of your find...Shipping and insurance can be half of the item(s) cost!!

title: This interface is confusing
text: This interface is confusing.  I have difficulty navigating it. It kicks me out regularly. And I can't back up a step when I need to.

title: Shop owners should respond to purchase orders.
text: I enjoy shopping on Ruby Lane, but the shop owners do notrespond to the purchase order. It would be nice to know if myitem has been mailed and when I can expect arrival.

title: Expensive Shipping & Confusing website
text: The shipping cost will prevent me from purchasing again. They seem outrageous compared to other sites. It will now have to be an item I feel I can't find anywhere & want so badly that I can't stop thinking about it before I purchase again. I will stick to my local antique shops, etsy and shopping when I travel. The website is also a bit user "unfriendly".

title: There have been no provisions made for…
text: There have been no provisions made for the buyers with resale numbers. I am not sure I understand how such a thing could happen by a company that prides itself on good customer service. The fees are too high and have deterred some customers from purchasing. I also miss the dolly cam with Rachael.

title: Unfair, Automated Extra Fees
text: I  don't like the additional charges called tax & fees.  It does not represent the actual tax rate that is required for merchants to apply to purchases for the state I live in.  Also, the fee makes it appear as a service charge for handling and the merchants are already charging shipping and handling fees.  With limited ability to return, and with retail merchants offering free shipping and free return shipping, Ruby Lane is no longer a place I will look for bargains.

title: After being a Ruby Lane customer for…
text: After being a Ruby Lane customer for several years, this will probably be my last purchase. I take exception to the newly added service fee.

title: sign-in problems
text: I found your sign-in forms difficult to navigate-----had a heck of a time trying to change my billing/shipping address. Needs to be more user-friendly for old technophobes like myself.

title: I have been buying off of Ruby Lane for…
text: I have been buying off of Ruby Lane for many years & I also promote the site to my Doll friends. Very disappointed to see the new service fee attached , along with the state taxes ? Don't the Vendors pay enough in listing & maintenance fees to cover this? I recently received a note from a vendor who say they are leaving RL because of the added costs. POO on RL for being so greedy!

title: I had a very difficult time with…
text: I had a very difficult time with placing my purchase because your “make offer” did not work.  So back and forth with seller over 4 days and 2 emails to ruby lane did not solve the problem.  Out of desperation the store owner and I agreed on a time EST and PST for her to change the purchase price .  I stood by and counted down the time.  At 12:04 the agreed upon sale price was displayed and I placed the order.  It should not have been so hard.  You’re response to my email was unsatisfactory.  I have purchased  items before but at asking price. No problem.  So I give you credit But as a result +5-2=3Delightful to serve worked hard for the sell and item arrived in perfect condition, very happy.

title: Additional service fee to run Ruby Lane website added at checkout...not well received.
text: I purchase often from Ruby Lane and have been pleased with the service, but my most recent purchase had a service fee from Ruby Lane to run the site.  I do not feel the purchaser should pay for the site.  I had committed to purchase the object and then see an $11.50 fee in addition to the purchase...not my responsibility.

title: I doubt anyone loves the service fees…
text: I understand taxes.  I understand postage costs are high.  No one can help that. I understand that Ruby Lane needs to charge a service fee, now. But the percentage RL chages reminds me of an auction house's fees.  Except you are not an auction house.  You don't set up the items or make them presentable to a buying audience.  You don't set an actual, physical venue.  You do not have to hire security or auctioneers, send out catalogs, etc,   You don't set up the open telephone lines for on-line bidders. You do nothing but run a website and advertise in a few places.  Now you want a big fee for doing what you've done for years, for free.  Why didn't you charge a modest fee all along?  Then there wouldn't be this sticker shock now.    Of course, most sellers will just eat the fee and take the loss.  How long do you think they can afford to do that?  No more exclusively on Ruby Lane.   And no more big purchases on Ruby Lane for me.   Small ones.

title: I have always shopped Ruby Lane as my…
text: I have always shopped Ruby Lane as my to-go shopping for antiques of uniqueness and quality. On my last purchase, I was frustrated by the additional $17.64 for fees and tax on a $100 item!! Taxes I understand, but the attached RL fees are unfortunately going to cause me to search other avenues to obtain my antique purchases.

title: The website when it comes time to pay…
text: The website when it comes time to pay is very, very slow.  So slow that I left things in my desired cart because it was taking so long.  I did like the great selection and the prices were very good.  On the things I was able to purchase, I feel I got my money’s worth.  We’ll see when the actual products arrive.

title: Disappointed
text: FIrst, I absolutely love the shop Silver by Patrick. But my most recent transaction left me with a negative impression of Ruby Lane. A service fee? Really? Also, my state charges sales tax, but I was charged over the .0825 rate. Why is this allowed? Price gouging!

title: Five stars for Vintage Elixir
text: Five stars for Vintage Elixir!  She is lovely, responsive, and knowledgable.  However, RL's new fee policy is unreasonable and will force me to abandon Ruby Lane after years of patronage. It is unfair to the veneers and the customers.

title: An inflationary feeling in the collecting world
text: Merchandise is good and there are good avenues for communication with sellers.  My biggest recent problem is the addition of the fees and mandatory tax, which increases costs by over 10 percent.  Similar recent practices on ebay (mandatory tax for all purchases) feel extremely inflationary.  I realize that you're probably complying with a law, but it's a lot to be hit with all at once, especially if the bulk of your income is used to build up collections.  So, you cut back on purchases to compensate.  And sellers are driven out of business, which is a real shame.  It feels like the end of an era of convenient online collecting, perhaps it's best to spend money in totally different ways.

title: Ruby Lane is not a favorite site.
text: Ruby Lane has some wonderful items to offer, but I do not like that I cannot find out prior to purchase all the extra costs involved in the purchase.  Also, I like to immediately pay for my items and expect shipping to occur shortly after; on Ruby Lane I am now waiting (and have no idea how long the wait will be) to find out what my costs will be and finally pay for the item.  I do not like this process and probably will not continue viewing items and purchasing from this site.

title: I paid for a bracelet that I didn’t…
text: I paid for a bracelet that I didn’t want. There was no way to cancel itSo I was stuck paying for it.All I wanted was the beautiful pearl earrings, I never ordered the bracelet, I don’t like it.Thank you, I will pay for it.

title: Much has changed at RL and not for the…
text: Much has changed at RL and not for the better. I would like to not use PayPal after many of my customers complaints. But RL states that I must use one online payment. I had a nasty x girlfriend of my son make fake purchases just to leave me terrible reviews. She did this numerous times over a week. I asked both Ruby Lane and Trust Pilot to please remove these reviews--both did NOTHING. So my only option was to remove all my reviews--great and terrible. I would like both RL and Trust pilot to step up to protect their sellers as I am loyal to RL. I love the blocked bidder list, the yearly accounting, the excellent photos and easy transaction pages etc.  But, it is time to live in the real world--where angry sick people try to hurt others and destroy a sellers reputation. This to me and many other sellers is a no brainer--just do the right thing both of you.

title: I dislike the added fee and tax without…
text: Too many fees and no tax exempt optionI dislike the added fee and tax without the opportunity to use my tax exempt status. I will be buying lees from RL in the future due to these changes. Very disappointing from a regular buyer and seller on RL

title: Unlike the estimable Etsy
text: Unlike the estimable Etsy, the Ruby Lane site is very difficult to use because it lacks flexibility.  Shoppers can't flip back and forth among items or sellers. Can't copy images to send to someone else or to keep for comparison to something on another site. Hard to find spot on screen for contacting seller. Receipts don't have photos of items purchased, limiting the depth of one's records. Etc. And the added fees are too high.  Obviously, the strengths of Ruby Lane are the sellers and their wares, not the site itself.

title: HELP!!!!!
text: HELP---PLEASE---Do something about your check out system...It was hard for me to figure it out....Thank God for the sellers help...I would have, had  to cancel my purchase.

title: Hard to find things
text: Hard to find things; checkout confusing.  Not user friendly.

title: I have always been very happy with my…
text: I have always been very happy with my experiences on Ruby Lane. The individual shop owners are, for the most part, reliable, knowledgeable and friendly. So it is sad to see some of my favorite shops will be closing due to changes in Ruby Lane fee schedules. If more shops close, I will look for them online and take my business elsewhere.

title: I can't believe the new fee structure
text: Date of experience: November 15, 2019

title: Waiting for invoice
text: It's been three days and I still haven't got the invoice of my purchase. Why you don't have Instant payment system like in Etsy and eBay?Also, I would buy more if the links of your newsletter worked. They don't, at least not in Android.

title: Received the order, but unsure if I'd recommend or order again…
text: (updated) I never received correspondence from the store within ruby lane in which I purchased the item but received it between two to three days of my purchase. The item I ordered for a friend was a silver match case that was perfect since it already endowed my friends initials on it. There were a couple of other dents on the antique item then was actually stated after I received it, but all in all since it was marked down, it seemed like a give-in. My friend was OVERJOYED by the gift, so I'm happy it turned out well in the end. I like the platform, but the next time I order, I will be sure to be very thorough concerning policy and noting correspondence. Even though my friend loved this gift, I'm not sure if I would order from here again, but I might.

title: Web pages are a bit difficult to…
text: Web pages are a bit difficult to navigate.I liked a piece of jewellery and made an offer, after making the offer to the seller, I did not get any indication whether my offer was sent to these.ler. Still waiting.

title: RL is cumbersome to use
text: RL is cumbersome to use.  Putting anything on your wish list dumps it into one catagory.  You have no choice, it just goes into a general catagory whether it belongs there or not.The wish list makes no sense.  To find something from a particular seller you must go through the entire list.  Why not alphabetize by sellers?  I have made these suggestions but get no response from RL.  So, obviously my opinion is not "important" to RL as Trust Pilot suggests.

title: While shopping for antique doll clothes…
text: While shopping for antique doll clothes on Ruby Lane I had a number of items in my cart.  Upon checking out I realized that each item was from a different "store" and I would have to pay shipping on items from each individual 'store'.  Clearly the additional shipping costs reduce the number of items to be purchased.  Ruby Lane is a good site to view many items but it was very disappointing to realize that the site does not accommodate multiple purchases under one order with one shipping cost

title: I would prefer to not use PayPal
text: I would prefer to not use PayPal. I don't know if this is the seller's policy or RubyLanes.  I would like more options.

title: stumbled on to this site while google…
text: stumbled on to this site while google searching for a particular item. they had it for sale from a vendor. not hard to buy, but HAD to create account etc., could not just buy as "guest"

title: Satisfactory Outcome Thanks to Rob Spear of Ruby Lane
text: Ruby Lane's Senior VP of Customer Support, Mr. Rob Spear, deserves 5 Stars for his patience and tenacity in dealing with (1) an unprofessional Ruby Lane shop owner who publicized my personal email address, (2) an incompetent Trustpilot representative, and (3) bugs in Trustpilot's software which prevented Mr. Spear from deleting the seller's mean-spirited remarks. The seller attacked me in an emotional response to my objective feedback about her overcharging postage and exaggerating her item's size and quality. The experience cost me over $23.00 in mailing fees. Ruby Lane is fortunate to have Rob Spear on their side. My 3-Star rating averages Mr. Spear's 5 Stars with the Ruby Lane shop owner's 1 Star.

title: Convoluted shopping
text: Convoluted way to shop. Before you check out you have to become a member. Then you are forced to go back and add not only your email but also your street address ALL before you find out the cost for shipping. After you order you’re not done, as THEN  you have to pay separately.

title: I'm not happy that I have to change…
text: I'm not happy that I have to change over to google chrome in order to pay my invoices. I don't appreciate google as a company. I feel they try to monopolize everything. I was especially aggravated when I had to use chrome to pay my pge bill online> I asked them to start sending paper bills> Happily I don't have to use chrome to pay pge anymore. I would prefer not to use google for anything>

It's really confusing and makes me think RubyLane is listing items that are not actually in stock. I expect this to work like ebay Buy It Now.

title: I would give a 5star rating
text: I would give a 5star rating, except for the confusing payment checkout procedures.I have bought about 6-7 items from Ruby lane, and the PayPal/Paypal credit payment instructions are very confusing.I paid today with PayPal Credit, filling in my visa information and when I was done, another screen popped up saying I need to pay for the item -So I did it again, and another screen popped up saying I needed to pay, and then another screen popped up and said this may have already been paid - duplicate invoice discovered (or something like that).It always is confusing and time consuming - am I the only person who has trouble with this?Have I paid double to HD Jewelers today?'Please help!!!Mary Morrissey

title: RL sites no longer let you print the…
text: RL sites no longer let you print the item you are interested in---or the item you have just bought. This is for my record keeping on my purchases.  I now have to cut & paste the info.This is NOT good customer service!

title: You told me the doll was mine
text: You told me the doll was mine,  had me pay for it,  and then said it was unavailable!!    How do I get my money back,  since you charged me for a doll you refuse to send to me?  What's up???   Sincerely,   Marianne  🕊

title: Better communication
text: I was trying to negotiate a better price and all of a sudden was told I agreed to purchase a dress. I emailed immediately and it was ignored. I kept getting emails reminding me to pay. If I had agreed to purchase I would have paid immediately. I will not be coerced into buying something I didn't agree to

title: Ruby Lane doesn’t listen to buyers
text: I shop Ruby Lane by going to my specific favorite sellers. I have never had an experience with a seller that was not concluded to my satisfaction. That having been said:1. There is no way of canceling an accidental purchase, even if it’s immediately. There is no guidance either (contact the seller? contact Ruby Lane? tough luck & suck it up?). 2. There is STILL no way to search for items based upon the shopper’s price criteria. If I want to search for 14k ring between $45-$175 there is no way to do so. I am stuck with Ruby Lane’s individual ranges which are not MY desired ranges and on top of this, you can search only ONE price range at a time. This is far too time consuming and definitely not buyer friendly. I would search for items on this site more frequently if the existing price search system were updated to at least be comparable with other sites where I also shop for antique items (Etsy, EBay, Poshmark). To add insult to injury, when I contacted the owners of the site, I was given the brush off and told I could search via their price range system, one range at a time. Period. So, in other words, they’re not interested in investing the money and effort to upgrade their system to make it more useful to potential buyers. I am spending MY time leaving this review although I’m sure it will be quite ineffectual. I don’t even know why Ruby Lane does the survey. They are obviously not responsive to user needs.

title: I think it is less than easy to use.
text: Date of experience: June 23, 2019

title: Great items, horrible payment process
text: Love the site but can’t stand the paying process.  Huge issues and have been complaining about them for months. 90% of the time I’m unable to use credit card and must mail a check as no other payment option will function.This has made me hesitant to use this site, have been looking and shopping elsewhere.

title: Difficult following the instructions…
text: Difficult following the instructions between, Check Out Now, Answer questions and another Check out now - all three at the same time.

title: Ruby Lane does not support the buyers
text: At one time, I was a VERY happy Ruby Lane buyer that shopped on a DAILY basis.  It was until they (Ruby Lane) proved to me they had zero integrity protecting me as a buyer from fraudulent (fake) merchandise as they state.  I lost over $9000 on a fake watch.  They refused to do a thing about it because I “made payments”! How stupid is that? Regardless of HOW I paid, the watch is still a FAKE! On top of that, they allowed this SELLER to badmouth ME on their site for asking them for assistance, causing other sellers to block me from buying.  From now on, I only buy very low price, items I need.  It is amazing to me that to this day, they have NEVER apologized or done a THING about (the seller they KNOW sold me the fake watch). I have proof from the Panerai watch boutique that the watch is a fake AND proof that the seller lied in his description from what I found out from the Panerai boutique about the date the watch was manufactured.  Still, RUBY LANE CONDONED THE SALE OF A FAKE WATCH.  This is the reason I went from being a daily shopper to nil.

title: One of my favorite places to look for…
text: One of my favorite places to look for interesting items, but the set up of the actual site is very frustrating.  I have at times had to contact individual shop owners, and ask them to contact rubylane to edit shopping cart, wishlist, etc.  Why don't they have a delete icon for individual items in shopping cart?  Why should I have go sign in ("your account has been inactive for some time") every time I have not visited the site for a few days.  I do have a life elsewhere.

title: You have started allowing sellers to list and sell inferior items
text: You have started allowing sellers to post things that are made in China and they may or may not state that. Your site used to be considered high end antiques. However, it is an online museum with ridiculous list prices. Sellers leave their wares on the site until they sell them at a show or store. Many of the items are not rare or antique. I rarely ever come to the site because it is a waste of time....same stuff over and over at outlandish prices.

title: It might be helpful if the person that…
text: It might be helpful if the person that setup this web page for ordering would have tried to use it.Very confusing! If you go to “ my account” there is no line item to “add address”!!! You actually need to click in the warning box under add address. Then it we back and forth putting an address and info but kept coming up with that error message!!! Finally after 20 minutes I stumbled onto getting the order put together and paid. Then in two seconds after clicking “ place order” the site just cleared off. Had no idea if our order went through because when we checked our cart was empty and the item said no longer available? I’d it wasn’t for confirmation email we would not have know we had purchased it!

title: Total amount
text: I would have preferred to know the shipping cost before placing the order.

title: This is the second purchase I have made…

I was instructed to purchase the ring and then he (owner) would send me an invoice. When I did that, I was sent to PayPal and had no options but to pay the full amount. Other than that, I love the jewelry. It is beautiful and well priced.

title: Thumbs Down
text: Got to site thru a search engine. Wanted to buy, clicked on PayPal in error, then couldn't change to credit card...difficult site to use....make it like etsy...never a problem buying there.

title: Your site has always been difficult to…
text: Your site has always been difficult to navigate for me(I made a purchase yesterday, and cannot find it to review today). Very frustrating so I usually look but do not buy on your site.

title: I’m getting someone something for their…

Usually they calculate your shipping and tax when you go to pay, but now I have to wait for someone to get back to me  delaying the process.

I see a slide toward junky Ebay type listings.Also, wish list sellers should be listed in alphabetical order.  It is far too hard to find an item you have listed to purchase.

title: Weird and uncomfortable
text: I think it is very strange that I can't immediately pay for the item I ordered but have to wait for a call from the seller, which is also strange.  It makes me very uncomfortable that I have to speak to the seller. If the item I'm purchasing weren't so difficult to find I would definitely find another place to purchase it.

title: I am not happy with the shipping and…

I always felt like I was on the defensive. Not being believed. That’s why I keep all correspondence. I still deal with Ruby Lane because I have their  guaranteed. title: Search Functionality Needs Work

title: Most of the vendors offer layaway (at a…

title: Two strikes you’re out

title: Newer Customer

Im somewhat new to this site so maybe I'll catch on soon.  I e-mail a shop and sometimes I get a response several days later or no response at all.

title: Prices too high...

My biggest concern with Ruby Lane is the pricing structure of late.  The prices have become somewhat exorbitant over the last several years, and I find I am making much more affordable purchases, for the same items on different websites.

title: So as not to waste time
text: So as not to waste time, please note that I'm telling you about things of which I am unhappy. (1) When I print an item I do not get the whole picture that is shown on the screen. (2) When I enlarge the picture to see a particular detail, something in your processes will not let me copy that screen.Everything else about Ruby Lane is convenient and easy for buyers.Thank you for this opportunity.

title: Most transactions are ok
text: Most transactions are ok.  Cat's Cradle purchase on 1/12/19 was not.  I paid immediately but hear nothing.  The following week I emailed and asked about shipping and tracking number.  Postage was $38 so I thought it would be insured.  After two days and no response, I contacted PayPal to reverse transaction.  They contacted seller and to this day he has not responded to PayPal or me.  The item did finally arrive, but this makes me leery  the other sellers.  No signature required for delivery with $38 postage and absolutely no correspondence, even to PayPal.  Plenty of dolls in the world.

title: Unable to leave feedback on Ruby Lane
text: I have been unable to leave feedback on Ruby Lane for the sellers with whom I've conducted business. That's a bummer for them because I've never had a bad experience with any purchase. So that is a plus for Ruby Lane! Thanks and I will do business here again!

title: Vendors and merchandise above exceptional - website, not so much. Atrocious customer account section!!!
text: All the vendors I’ve dealt with over the past 15 years have been excellent: knowledgeable, helpful, flexible. The website mechanics itself, though, are absolutely horrible!!! After you log in to your account, the customer experience is confusing and irritating. The categories make no sense whatsoever. This site has been in need of a revamp for years and this review is the one I always give and it is NEVER addressed. If Ruby Lane is losing customers - this atrocious customer section may be why.

title: I have purchased and signed up with…
text: I have purchased and signed up with Ruby Lane before, but don't use it often. With this latest purchase (thru Etsy) I kept getting bounced back to "Sign In" and no password was working. When I tried to reset password, the link did not work and I received no email detailing how to reset a password.I finally got so frustrated that I set up a new RL account at another email, just to complete the purchase.  In the future, I hope the process will go MUCH more smoothly.Oh, and they automatically added "insurance" to my order of a book. I couldn't see anyway to subtract that fee from the total. I feel buyers should have the option of paying for insurance, not be forced to pay that additional fee.Another irritation...

title: Paying individual vendors with varying

title: Ruby Lane would be a lot better if I…

title: Love Ruby Lane ....but....
text: Love Ruby Lane ....but..... When I tried to check out, I was routed to my deleted FaceBook account. There was no way to access my existing Ruby Lane account, no way to change the password. title: Password reset

title: I’ve bought a lot of things from…
text: I’ve bought a lot of things from Rubylane over the years. I’m generally happy. However I just made a purchase of two yards of antique ribbon. Price of shipping and handling and insurance, for two yards of ribbon was rediculous!!! Guess there trying to make extra money on this purchase!!!

title: Nice site with plenty of beautiful…
text: Nice site with plenty of beautiful items. Unfortunately I bought one only to get notified the next day that it had apparently sold to someone else. Am now waiting for my refund. Disappointed.

title: I love the vintage and antique range in…
text: I love the vintage and antique range in Ruby Lane and most sellers are honest in their descriptions and do their utmost to ensure you have a positive buying experience with them.  However, caution is needed if you put items on layaway as they are not covered under the return conditions of Ruby Lane's policies. I received an item that was described as platinum with a one carat solitaire diamond, but was just white gold and stone only .70cwt. I had no redress because it had been on a layaway for my son to use as an engagement ring. My son was a college student at the time and saved so hard for this ring. And the deceptive seller claimed to be GIA certified! Upsettingly, the seller refused to refund and would not accept a return and Ruby Lane said they were not responsible because of the layaway. Check sellers feedback and how long they have been selling on Ruby Lane. I still buy lots on Ruby Lane but follow that caution and stick to my favourite sellers.  .

title: The site is troublesome
text: The site is troublesome. I had to sign up for a new account because they couldn't find my account. That was annoying. They do have lots of great items. I don't like seeing all the things that are already sold or sale pending. Feels manipulative.

title: Item not available, order canceled.
text: Seller was unable to complete my purchase as they had sold the listed item previously.  The seller promptly issued a full refund, and as compensation offered a 15% discount on my choice of another of their items.  According to the seller, “Sometimes [Ruby Lane] does not take off items that have sold previously. I sold this item several months ago and did not realize it was still on the website.”  I think the seller did the best they could under the circumstances.  No harm, no foul.

title: I often get malware type fishing emails…

Often I give up on attempting to make a purchase and go straight to ETSY, rather than deal with applying for a new Password. Pay Pal:  PLEASE! just allow me to click the credit card I wish to use, as I'm never sure if PayPal is the bank, or AMEX is.  Show in print which credit card is being used for the purchase.

title: It automatically mark “Added To Cart,”…
text: It automatically mark “Added To Cart,” or similar, on various items, even though I did NOT want it added to my cart & did not enter it.   I initially wasted time trying to undo, which was fruitless, & even sent a message to one seller stating that I had not added it.  I may have pressed the heart-shape that was nearby to mark it for later consideration.  I had not yet finished viewing all similar items.     If the total number of supposed potential buyers is misleadingly increased to serve as a pressure-tactic on other potential buyers to purchase the item, then I must reconsider shopping on Ruby Lane.    Furthermore, customers should be clearly informed, in ADVANCE of writing a review, that the review is NOT for the sole use of TRUSTPILOT but will be publicly published with the customer’s name.  I would have reconsidered writing one if purpose of TRUSTPILOT was not solely to improve Ruby Lane.  That would not require public posting.

title: Different ratings as a BUYER vs. SELLER
text: AS A BUYER: I have found all the shop owners to be trustworthy, fair and honest.  The few returns I did were hassle-free. There were never any surprises with the things I ordered; everything described fairly and accurately, held to Ruby Lane's high standards. As a buyer, I would probably give the site five stars.  However...AS A SELLER: I closed my shop.  Prices more than DOUBLED since it was first opened. Worse, the process of having to have all my photos "processed" was confusing, time-consuming and -- worst of all -- resulted in POOR PHOTOS. Pictures that were BLOODLESS...lacking character...and in many cases, not nearly as flattering as the old system.  Plus: we had to pay for this process.  Unfair.  I have opened a shop elsewhere with better results and more freedom, and have had better luck selling there and on eBay. Too bad.  I would have given this site five starts across the board, if not for this new system.

title: Wonderful antiques, no customer protection
text: I love the antique items offered on Ruby Lane; the selection is so good that it keeps me coming back. However, Ruby Lane offers next to no protection for customers. In one instance, a seller changed her mind about following through with a sale because she got a better offer privately AFTER the item had been purchased and paid for. In another instance, I was sold a bracelet represented to be 14 KT gold which was actually only gold fill. In both situations, I asked Ruby Lane to intervene, but they always said they couldn't do anything about it, that it was between myself and the seller. I shouldn't have come back after these experiences, but there's no other online platform with such selection in the way of antiques. Be warned, though--Ruby Lane is only as honest as the seller you're dealing with.

Don't ask someone for their payment method until the purchase is to take place.

I decided to call the vendor, but the vendor's phone number was not shown.  Only the address was shown.  An email was available and so was Skype, but the vendor did not answer my Skype call. So, I am waiting for an email response.  I am nervous about having purchased something without being able to clarify my question.  I think the detailed pictures should be available to apurchaser even after the purchase, plus the vendor's phone no.  should there still be a questions about the item.Usually I find Ruby Lane very good, but this time is a bit disappointing.

title: Brooch
text: Website very difficult to navigate and does not facilitate comparison shopping nor even finding same again. This site requires perseverance! And am I really supposed to be motivated by how many have the same item in their cart or wish list?

title: Lovely Site but Beware of Ridiculous Shipping Some Sellers Charge
text: Ruby Lane has beautiful merchandise and many great sellers.  Their prices are wicked high compared to Etsy sellers of the same items but waiting for a sale is fun shopping - usually.The problem is their system for determining shipping.  Their latest sale is a great example.  I had four small silver items totaling less than 100$ after sale price from one seller.  Shipping was over $17 and then the insurance was another $8 plus.  I do a lot of shipping and the cost to ship, with insurance, in a box should have been around $6, including insurance.  This happened with 2 other sellers . did not order and left the site after ordering the one item that was fairly priced for shipping.  This was too bad because I would have placed some substantial orders but not with their insane shipping.  The person from whom I purchased promptly contacted me with a shipping date and friendly info so that was really great.

title: difficulty with purchase. recorded phone message was confusing
text: I nearly gave up on the purchase because of difficulty with password., address ,credit card etc.Old password didn't work then hassle with getting new one.But I wanted the doll very much so I just stuck with it and did get my purchase.I like Ruby Lane in general and prefer to purchase with RL more than ebay or others on internet.

title: Unnecessarily complicated .
text: Innecessarily complicated to pay when NOT using pay pal. It seems as though the site keeps trying to push PayPal. Also complicated to access past purchases on buyers account.I am still very fond of Ruby Lane!

title: Expensive and difficult if not impossible problem solving.
text: Brand new customer.  Ordered on impulse and IMMEDIATELY changed my mind.  Within a minute .  nowhere to go, no help to be offered.  Retracting a bid within a minute should not be impossible.  an hour of doing what I could later. I hope I cancelled my bid with newbies apology

title: Ruby lane review
text: Ruby lane has some great vendors, but sometimes it's difficult to get a response. title: ordering items

title: Would be better if all items would ship to Canada
text: Would be better if all items would ship to Canada. Other than that the site is great

title: A little site clarification would make things so much better!
text: I just attempted my first purchase on Ruby Lane.  I am a long- time buyer on Etsy and E-Bay, looking for vintage bakelite.  I tried to make a purchase, used Pay Pall, which has always been so easy.  My offer was accepted, I indicated I would pay with Pay Pal, and expected to see the transaction completed.  Instead, I get a message about an "open purchase order" (????)and was given instruction to get into my account, go to " open purchase orders" and (again??? what next???).  I called the dealer, explained that I seemed to be unable to  complete the sale.   Told her I would try again, and get back to her, but that I definitely wanted the brooch.  I tried again, and this time I found the Pay Pal button which was so far below the text of the message that I hadn't seen it.  I did pay, and called the dealer again to tell her I thought the transaction was completed.   Dealer is great!  We had a good laugh about it all.  I'll know better in the future, but my first-time trying to navigate my way to the conclusion of the sale was iffy.

title: Great site but I had difficulty creating an account
text: Excellent website, well organized, looks like a lot quality material. I found what I was looking for and purchased. My "friction" was creating an account. It could be me, but I kept getting looped around to entering the same info. Gave up and used the Facebook option. Was susscessful logging in.

title: Overpriced shipping on some stores.
text: I started to order a vintage hat. The shipping for one hat was over $20. That is a huge ripoff. It is not honest. Beware before you order from shops you are not familiar with. Others have been perfect and came well protected.

title: Forcing my to log on via Facebook - why?
text: I have (had?) a Ruby Lane user ID and password. When I entered the password it came back as incorrect. When I requested a new password I was prompted to log onto FB and use those credentials to change my password. I don't want to log onto RL via FB, I just want to reset my RL password. I tried several times with no success. I was forced to log on via FB in order to complete my transaction. Why???  I can understand if you want it to be an option, but you shouldn't take away my RL credentials just because I have a FB ID that is tied to the same email address. My transaction was smooth, but the log on process was a nightmare.

title: The check out process was confusing
text: The check out process was confusing when it got down to method of payment. Usually, when you check credit card the boxes comes up to get your credit card info. Your method kept you thinking you were paying by PayPal. I would have been checked out in a jiffy if it were not for that.

title: I typed in half dolls and never found this item.

title: Slogging thru' the PayPal Jungle.
text: The often complex extra steps of using Paypal, the difficulty in finding Paypal instructions, and the necessity to change their unchangeable default payment source (e.g. bank vs credit card) has caused me troubles before when buying from sites which use it.  Paypal is NOT always intuitive.  On my order tonight, I was redirected to the Paypal site,  which caused me to leave Ruby Lane.  Once there, I was taken to a dead-end page.  I had to re-google and go to Ruby Lane again. There, my cart was empty even though my order was unfinished.  I finally managed to find and complete the order by going thru' "My Acccount/Orders."  Lots of extra time & frustration.  If Amazon can let a customer pay with a credit card to Amazon and sundry other Amazon Market Place vendors........why can't EBAY and Ruby Lane devise a simple credit card method?  The PayPal struggle earns a 2 star demerit.

title: Trouble Updating Address with iPhone
text: I didn't remember what my password was, so signed in with Facebook account option. Selecting treasure and getting to checkout was easy, but since I was signed on with Facebook, Ruby Lane needed my address. Updated my address with a lot of trouble because the form doesn't reduce in size or scroll or shrink to fit the iPhone screen. Finally using both hands, one to hold the form in place and one to click ok, I was able to complete the transaction. Initially selecting PayPal Credit got to PayPal with "infinite spins". Canceled PayPal screen. Email at least let me know my purchase was committed but trouble getting into Ruby Lane with Facebook because again the screen presumes you are on a large screen computer. Managed to complete the transaction. Make iPhone friendly, please.

title: the philosophy of a global online store
text: Rubylane is the greatest international antiques shop window, and I often find here very special pieces. I'm very grateful for this, but I must add that sometime the sellers are unreasonable, because the shipping costs are too high and even more because often the American sellers use Rubylane   showcase  but they then not send to other Countries. This seems to me unfair and  contrary to the philosophy of a global online store and I think it constitutes a major handicap.

title: Interesting vintage selections, checkout process a bit touchy...
text: I like the vintage offerings on Ruby Lane.  As with any resale shop the value can be questionable but buyers should be aware of that fact. Specifically, there is no place where it asks for the delivery name and address before making a payment.  As far as I could tell, my address information wasn't in my account information either (and I was a bit concerned as I have moved since my previous Ruby Lane purchase). I sent my address information to the shop owner for my purchase and I hope that will work out satisfactory.

title: Love the jewelry
text: Love the jewelry, but had some trouble with the website when ordering.

title: Sellers Opinions Don't Always Matter
text: As a Ruby Lane seller, I value my reputation for honesty and integrity. When the Ruby Lane administration disagreed with me over the date and originality of one of the items in my shop, they did not ask me to verify my description of the item, or state the specific concerns they had about it. The item was simply removed from my shop. The description was not even allowed to be modified to their satisfaction. The message I got was either:  I am dishonest, or that I am ignorant of the types of articles that I have been handling daily and selling for 35 years. A bit of a slap in the face to a professional dealer who dutifully pays her shop fees every month. That said, as a dealer, Ruby Lane is an easy platform to launch a small business from. It is relatively inexpensive, easy to use for buyers and sellers, and reaches a wide audience. I have close to 300 customers through Ruby Lane, most of whom are repeat customers. That said, their interactions with the dealers on their site could be improved.

title: Site good.  Listing photos awful.
text: Buying experiences have all been positive, but I HATE the new picture processing every listing now must go through. The initial photos looks bloodless. The items look dull, dreary, lifeless. Because of that, I have been buying many more items from those sites than from Ruby Lane. In terms of how I have been treated by various sellers and the general Ruby Lane experience:  5 stars.  But the items now look so unappetizing, I'm giving you just 3.  Sorry, guys.

title: Payment was more than a little confusing.
text: Being that I just ordered the item, I can't comment yet on the delivery process.  It was truly confusing the way your bill payment is conducted.  I shop on line all the time and this is the first time I've encountered anything like this.

title: Received a Smashed Antique Clock and No Customer Support
text: While I enjoyed browsing the site, my actual purchase through this site has been a complete nightmare.  I purchased a small antique clock.  When it arrived the glass on the face was smashed.  I was told that it is my problem as I paid for shipping insurance as part of the cost.  So now I am embroiled in on-line form-filling, scanning and pdfing to try and get my money back.  I am the only one who had nothing to do with how the package was shipped or treated in transit and yet I am doing all the work to resolve the problem.  I will never do this kind of on-line shopping again.  I am very disappointed in how I am being treated by the seller as on my own when none of this was my fault. I just want my money back!!!.

title: A bit confusing!  But turned out well in the end.
text: I sent an inquiry about the product I want to purchase.  I didn't get any answers, just reply e-mails saying they got my message and someone will get back to me.  Nobody did.  Since the website says "easy return policy" I decided to go ahead and make the purchase, although my questions were not answered.  When selecting a payment option of what I thought would be my credit card, it said I would have to go through PayPal which I didn't want to do.  I then selected "alternative method of payment" and the website said the seller would be contacting me by phone.  In this day of e-commerce, this is a lot of work to purchase one item.  Not sure why they can't just take my credit card and be done with it.  Still playing phone tag with the seller.  If I didn't need this very unique item so badly, I would have cancelled the order, but I'm still hanging in there.  Hopefully the quality of the product if & when the order is processed, will make up for all of the hassle.UPDATE:  Seller did contact me within a reasonable time frame and the transaction was completed by telephone.  Follow up was excellent with an e-mail from the seller regarding ship date, anticipated arrival date & tracking number.  Also received a confirmation from the shipper.  It's all good, although it took a few extra steps to accomplish.  Upping my review from 2 to 3 stars.

title: No review on stores and  uncomfortable communication
text: It uncomfortable to communicate with shop owner and to respond ,also no review of store

title: Everything Great, Except One Issue
text: I placed an order on Ruby Lane today.  The site is user-friendly and seems to have nice stuff and reputable sellers. However, I wanted to be able to use my billing address as one address (associated with my credit card) and my shipping address as another (because I wanted to send the item to a place where I knew that the package would be kept safely for me until my arrival in the evening - we have had packages go missing around this time of year last year in my neighborhood - because of the holidays).  Anyway, apparently Ruby Lane doesn't permit that, and when I tried to get the seller to accommodate me, she didn't want to, claiming there were issues associated with it.  I don't understand why Ruby Lane doesn't permit this - Etsy does - and quite frankly, it's an issue for those who want to send gifts directly to someone other than themselves.

title: Response regarding damaged merchandise
text: I ordered an inkwell and received the item promptly. However, it was damaged in shipment. I contacted the seller and still have not heard anything from the seller after a week.  Although there are many wonderful items on Ruby Lane, I am hesitant to risk another order with the same results if the merchandise should arrive damaged. This was my first order with Ruby Lane and am disappointed in the outcome.

title: Good point and challenges
