title: Not my favorite.
text: If you want to see a category... say "yellow gold rings" you get a mishmush of things including, often items that have nothing to do with gold rings.Whenever I have purchased they take their time to mail out. For example, I just bought a ring, I'm paying expedited shipping... and three days after the purchase it still hasn't shipped. Waste of money.Vendors don't respond very quickly to questions and sometimes not at all.I like that I can return things if they don't suit, but overall I think you could improve customer service and tighten up your categories so that if you want to see specific things other items aren't thrown in as well.

title: UGLY WEBSITE
text: All I want to say is that Ruby Lane has a SUPER UGLY WEBSITE and needs to get with it !!!! It needs to be MODERN, SMART, AND EYE-CATHING !!!!

title: Great site but the checkout process did not go smoothly.
text: My recent experience with Ruby Lane was my first.  I like the site very much and found exactly what I wanted.  It was difficult to complete the registration and purchase process on the website, however, and I had to contact the site through their chat services.  It took over 15 minutes on chat, but the problem was satisfactorily resolved.  The person who assisted with that solution was "Sunny".  I found him/her knowledgable, friendly, and helpful.  I will definitely use the site again, but when the website is updated, please consider making the registration and purchase screens easier to navigate.

title: You ask too soon!
text: I ordered,and purchased. The product is now "in review" for sale. That leaves THREE parties wondering: Seller, Purchaser, Person on Want List.  Stupid. It's Sold or Not Sold.  If Sold fails, then it;s Not Sold. There is no "Maybe", and you really irritate people this way.

title: Vintagediva purchase
text: The $150.00 I paid for the dress is too expensive; no designer name, looks cheap.  Thank you.

title: good producs mosly good cendors, terrible website
text: Your vendors sell mostly good productsI have been a good customer for years. Your website is terrible.  It won't recognize the names of shpswhich actually list their shop names exactly as I type them -and if for example I type in Marie Wu it says no such person,If Itype in Marie Wu Eclectic Art it says no such shop---but that isTHE NAMEOF HER SHOP.  REPAIR THIS EASY TO FIX ERROR

title: Ruby Lane is great
text: Sometimes difficult to relate with dealers.  I don't always know how to communicate my amount of my offer.

title: Your site makes it very hard to buy someone a surprise gift from their wishlist
text: A customer should be able to view someone's wish list to buy a surprise gift without having to know the person's username and password. As it is, I have to sneak into my wife's account and view the wish list.  Then I have to go to the dealer and get the item number.  To complete the purchase as a surprise, I need to get into my account, but that is impossible because when I come back in to Ruby Lane, the site insists that I am my wife and has nowhere to log in as myself.   So, I must go to a different computer to log in under my account and complete the purchase.  This all seems a little clunky. Thanks.

title: Ruby Lane Purchase
text: The item bought is on the way to me at this point. It has not arrived. The listing stated World Wide Free Shipping and when check out came a $19 shipping and handling charge was added to the invoice total that was called "Insurance". What a misleading bunch of garbage. International insurance is the biggest joke. I will update my opinion as the transaction evolves. So far I would ask more questions before making another purchase from anyone. The website name "Ruby Lane" means nothing when the truth lies in the facts and details. I'm not impressed at this point.

title: Love the variety, did not like the site.
text: Great variety and search capacities.  Navigating the site was another matter.  Could not get my pc or Mac to allow me to enter my mailing and billing addresses.  Finally got that done accidentally when I was looking at my account.  Please set up some processes for approaching your site like a first time potential customer.  THe merchant I was dealing with saved the day and allowed me to buy an important (to me) gift.

title: Advertising & Features
text: I love the design and overall RubyLane website.  As a seller and as a buyer there are a few things that I recognize need improvement and changing.  One as a seller, I never see RubyLane offering paid advertising, yet they collect monthly fees from us for the sole purpose of advertising.  They may have social media websites, however, they are all free for everyone.  In addition, when one joins Ruby Lane they offer no support to sellers, such as, featuring new sellers possibly weekly, allowing buyers to see what new sellers have joined and what they are offering.  To have R/L publish a list of all new sellers in an alphabetical list, is not my idea of seller support. I hope they will take a serious look at their advertising and better support of new sellers.

title: choice of paymrnt source
text: They should use ofer other credit cards as a source of payment besides PAPAL

title: Purchasing an item = Agonizing experience
text: I can't believe how complicated RUBY LANE site has made trying to purchase an item.  It may only be a one time use for sure! The seller was more than helpful and I haven't received the purchase so this is NOT rating the item purchased or seller, just the complicated Ruby Lane

title: COUNTEROFFERS
text: Ruby Lane needs to explain how to process agreed-upon counter offers.  Twice now I've made a counter-offer to a store that has been accepted.Nowhere is it explained how to process these agreed upon counter offers so that the merchant can adjust the price.  AAAAGGGGHHHH!!! Gives me a royal headache trying to figure out whether or not I handled it correctly.

title: Time it takes to bring up photos of the goods for sale.
text: I find that it takes far longer to wait for the photo of the goods I`m interested in to finally take the page. I get sick of waiting and click off. I`m sure it was much faster  2 months ago. has it been changed?

title: confusion about pay pal connection at check out
text: The site was fine .... the check out was confusing.  I don't like confusion when it comes to making payments through pay pall.  It is not a financial organization I  trust b/c of their lack of clarity and transparency. I will be able to make a complete review after I receive my merchandise.

title: Nervous.
text: I found what I needed with ease. Then I tried to pay. The site crashed. I did get an email confirming a purchase order, but i have no clue if my credit card information went through. Later I logged into my account (I am a first time user) and I tried contacting the seller through RubyLane. When i submitted my email the site crashed again! I don't know if that went through either. I can tell you I am extremely nervous. I am buying a gift ...now I'm not sure what is happening with my credit card or if I will get the gift I have been searching for over the last 6 months.

title: New Customer
text: In entering my new information, I found the web site difficult to get around. I'm sure my purchase will arrive in good shape.

title: Confused as to what to do.
text: With all the different dealers it is hard to know what to do. Some take credit cards others want checks and then you have to search for the address and person to send the check to. It would be nice to print out the payment and the address for those wanting checks and how to make it out and to whom. That would make it easier to complete the order and to keep a record of your order. It would all be on the printed summary page.(one page)

title: Fair resource-needs better organization, classification system and integrity process in weeding out shoddy vendors
text: I've used Ruby Lane periodically but have found myself disenfranchised over some of the vendors' misleading statements about the quality of the jewelry construction or the jewels themselves.  For example, "stones" that were "tested" and found later by my jeweler to be fake or the stones themselves were loose and lost within two weeks of purchase.  Further, they should incorporate a better system by which the vendors can list age of the product they're listing to better classify products as new, vintage or antique.

title: Fakes and misrepresented items
text: Rubylane is billed as "The world's largest curated marketplace for vintage & antiques." but there are a lot of fakes and misrepresented items.   Apparently, only another seller can report an item.  I have returned several items because they were not as represented.  In all cases the item went right back on Rubylane without any change in the description.  If the site is truly curated, then returns should be monitored and the reason for the return , if reasonable, should be required to be added to the items description.

title: The Good and the Bad About Ruby Lane
text: Ruby Lane has a wide selection of merchandise, but I am not fond of the way items are listed or managed.  It's hard to tell sometimes when something has been sold and there is no database of sold items for research or comparison within or outside of the site.  The search engine isn't specific enough and leads one to get unwanted listings.  The payment procedures are easy to use and the want list function is good.

title: Make An App Please
text: It would be a way better experience using an app instead of a mobile browser.  Your competitors have had apps for ages!!

title: hmmmmmm
text: 2 good purchases, 2 bad out of 4 total - it's difficult to trust internet for purchases of jewelry which all my purchases were. I'm not confident in trying again - i continue to window shop; until i see something fantastic i have to have!

title: Annoying and unnecessary emails
text: My review is to stop completely those - "your opinion is important for us.... "  Emails you forward me every time I take action on your site.  I found some cool stuff and got replies from sellers.  In total will spend around 700 USD and those annoying emails you keep sending me are totally ruining my experience.  Have some confidence and stop begging for reviews. It's weak. Hope you take this the right way.  Very best.

title: I am very Happy to finally get these PINK boots.
text: I was not HAPPY when I tried to sign in and couldn't get My password to go thru.  Finally I saw the (forgot password) and put in a new one.  If it continues to go thru I'll be Happy.  I have stopped buying from one seller because every time I started to buy something I got WRONG password.  That is very irritating!!!  I just figure I'll wait and see.  I will send check for shoes tomorrow and have paid for boots.

title: Site was difficult to sign up/sign in for.
text: I was trying to order something during your Red Tag sale and it took me over 25 minutes to make your site happy.  It even told me the password I'd used 10 minutes prior was not the correct password and made me go through all the frustration of changing it.  Fortunately, I did not lose my item.

title: hard to use
text: I have found it difficult to bid on Ruby Lane.This morning my bid offerings never reachedthe seller.

title: The postal charges, communication and make an offer
text: Some of the sellers refuse to give more than one option for postal charges, sometime double the cost of the item to be posted which leaves the buyer the only option, to withdraw.I prefer to communicate throug Ruby Lane site, not my email.As for the 'make an offer' the buyer should be sincere and want to give more than USD 0.50 discount. Why bother if that is all!!!!!!

title: so so
text: I had ordered a small Blue Cobalt oil lamp that was advertised as antique. At first I was impressed  with it. After a short time of having it I had shown it to a person that specialies in antique lamps. I was told that it was probably made in the 60's and was made purposely to look old. Not happy about this information and probably won't be ordering any other items from this site.

title: A lot of retail prices...
text: There is a vast selection of products from almost every era you can thing of. However, there are a lot of retail prices for used things that aren't worth much of anything used. I can totally get behind paying way more for real gold or things from the 1800s...the scuffed and marred silverware from maybe the 70s-90s, the half chewed on plastic toys from my childhood?...not so much.  All buyers that I've had have been lovely. The rest I have at arms' reach because I am only going to browse, not buy junk, so there's no need to even talk to them.

title: Buy a lot of stuff, but don't like management
text: Sellers do not always ship very fast as opposed to sellers on eBay.  I have bought so much from RR, but the prices are often over-inflated. Quality of items is usually very good though. My biggest problem is selling.  Very expensive to sell on RR.  When I made an honest mistake in categorizing, they just jumped in and took it down.  I would rather that they asked me to take it down.  I discontinued selling after that.  I was very insulted.  I just don't advise selling on Ruby Lane.  Also, why sell your items just to pay the monthly dues?

title: Recent changes to Website
text: It is now harder to navigate around, slower to load, and accessing my wishlist has become difficult.It was fine before.

title: Kept me informed, communicated without hesitation.
text: The price of the item that I purchased while fair, I think that you could have taken a few moments to take the print out of the frame and inspected it before putting it up for sale. It turned out that the print that I purchased was laid down and not loose. I think without a doubt that I would not have bid on this item. Although still it was not in need of cleaning so I am satisfied!

title: Seller never answered questions
text: I found what I was looking for but seller never answered questions about authenticity

title: overpriced items
text: After placing a low, but reasonable bid for an item I received the rejection along with a note stating my bid was insulting. Methinks the asking price was insulting. It's too easy for buyers to comparative shop and find prices for similar items online, so pricing has to be in line with the going market rates. Ruby Lane has nice items but over the top pricing drives customers to other vendors.

title: Wrong product sent
text: When I called Ruby Lane to let them know they had sent the wrong color and wrong item number of the storage bench I had ordered, they wanted me to send them photos which I did right away. After that, if approved, they would send me a return label and have Fedex pick it up at their expense. (Apparently the correct product was out of stock) Several days later, when I hadn't heard from them, I called back. They told me they hadn't received the photos, so I should resend them and then they would later approve the return. I explained that not only did I have to re-pack a heavy piece of furniture, but that it was occupying a big chunk of space in my entryway. I told them I didn't appreciate being treated that way in light of the fact that it was THEIR MISTAKE. They finally sent the return label. My first and last purchase from Ruby Lane.

title: stop the arbitrary restocking fee of sellers
text: I've greatly curtailed my buying on Ruby Lane due to the practice of allowing sellers to charge you a fee; usually 10%; to return something to them regardless of whether the seller misrepresented an item or poorly presented it in his/her description.  I thought restocking fees pertained to layaways; not fully paid for items purchased sight unseen, often with poor photography and poor descriptions,  Or just plain misrepresentation.    I had such an encounter with a seller; wanted to charge me a 10% restocking fee for a 550$ item that she had misrepresented as a doll's dress when it was an altered child's dress--not worth the 550$ to me.  In the photos, I couldn't see this.  I saw it when I got it in my hands and I told her it was a child's dress. So I wanted to return it.  She acted as if she couldn't possibly be wrong and she was going to charge me 55$ to return the dress.   Of course, I didn't return it.  So, she made her 550$ from me but she lost a customer.  I informed RL about my experience but I've no idea if anything came of it.  Many sellers on RL do not pull the restocking fee on their customers.  Most sellers are wonderful folks, and I have had mostly good experiences all told.  I want to say that.  But this last experience has left a bad taste in my mouth.  Only Ruby Lane can put some controls on the restocking fee policy. A few sellers abuse this restocking fee policy so as not to take items back. I found one, and one seller is one too many for me.

title: Strange Experience with a Ruby Lane merchant.
text: Until last week I would say that my experiences have been good.  At that time I received a message from a merchant who contacted me saying that she had just acquired the matching bracelet to a Juliana necklace and earrings that I had recently purchased.  She wanted to know if I would be interested in buying the bracelet since I had the necklace and earrings.  After some confusion as to what the bracelet looked like and wether or not it truly matched my set I asked how much she wanted for it.  Instead of replying to that question she said that she wanted to know if I would be willing to sell the necklace and earrings back to her.  I replied that I was not interested in selling back the items that I had bought.  (If she wanted to buy back my items, why did she contact me asking if I wanted to buy the bracelet?) I again asked her for the price of the bracelet, since I was indeed interested in purchasing it.  In response she replied that she wanted $600 for the bracelet and that it had already been sold.  (If she had already sold it, why did she ask me in the first place? And $600 for a Juliana bracelet is grossly overpriced.  I paid that much for the necklace and earrings.  Overall I am confused about this interaction and what the intentions of the merchant truly were.  There is a ring of dishonesty in the entire thing.  I am happy that she found someone to pay her $600 for it when most others are selling for about $150.

title: Choosing
text: It's VERY difficult to see an item that you click on. The scroll won't work to get past the "title" of the item and to read the description. Also after you're done you get sent to the top of the page again and have to find your way down. It makes it hard to decide if something is worth all the effort.

title: Checkout
text: Hi there....your checkout process is onerous and inefficient to say the least....for eg what does PO or purchase order mean.....do not use terms that are confusing ... ..also when an item is described as pristine it should be so, instead I just bought something that has paint loss and flecks of paint falling off ,and chips but the seller insisted the items were pristine ,despite my asking on 2 separate occasions  .....why is shipping quoted at $34.99 and yet on the shipping box it is listed as $20.00......( note shipping was not charged ) . These things make me leary of ordering again....please correct them .....thank you
